title.rendered: The hand of the Lord – Part 3, Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Devotions will continue in my absence (I will be on vacation) next week. Pastor Phil will be sharing and France will be sending the devotions out. Be blessed and keep me in your prayers. Ev

“Because the gracious hand of our God was on us, they brought us Sherebiah, a capable man, from the descendants of Mahli son of Levi, the son of Israel, and Sherebiah’s sons and brothers, 18 men; 19 and Hashabiah, together with Jeshaiah from the descendants of Merari, and his brothers and nephews, 20 men.” (Ezra 8:18-19)

The hand of God upon Ezra’s life continues to be seen all along the way, which is a great thing to realize.  God’s hand not only caused Ezra to study, obey, teach God’s Law and be an ambassador to the people Israel.  And not only did God bring Ezra into favor with the ungodly, causing the king to release the Jews from captivity which Ezra lead into Jerusalem to repair the temple and the city.  But God’s gracious hand was now on forty others that Ezra had influenced to follow him.

Most of us perhaps would like many people to follow us; however that is not always the case.  God gives us only what we can handle with His help.  God’s Hand is extremely big.  Serving Him requires dedication and a servant’s heart.  Perhaps that is why only forty followed Ezra out of all of Israel.  The service of God sometimes necessitates moving from a comfortable situation to perhaps a less desirable one, an unknown one, and one that must be stepped into with the eyes of faith.  However when God’s hand is on the move how can you go wrong when you are right in His will?

Many don’t desire to go further in the Lord because of the consequences that accompany such a following.  This call fors more of Him and less of you, He must increase and you must decrease.  Perhaps this is why such a small band followed Christ, yet that small band of men would literally have the testimony of going out and turning the known world upside down (Acts 17:6 KJV).  Ezra may not have had a large group, but small groups with God’s Big Hand are a majority and can accomplish much.  He had a band of insightful, wise, and clever men on his team.  There are numerous examples in Scripture on how God’s Big Hand upon a small group can accomplish more then a vast army of skilled soldiers.  God does more with less, but that less brings with them His Almighty Hand that is a foreigner to defeat!

Perhaps you desire that more follow the Lord with you more closely, committed, and compassionately.  Possibly though there is a small group with you that the Lord has His Hand upon will cause you to turn your world, your family, your neighborhood, your work place, your city, your nation, and your circle of influence upside down.  Walk with Him making sure that His Almighty Hand is upon you and your group.  Now go and be faithful!

Application:  Who is your group or should it be said God’s group?  God never intended us to be an island unto ourselves, but we need a small band of friends that have God’s Hand upon their lives to connect with, and walk with as we live for our Lord (See Heb 10:24-25).

Until the nets are filled….Blessings, Pastor Phil

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: The hand of the Lord – Part 2, By Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“and who has extended his good favor to me before the king and his advisers and all the king’s powerful officials. Because the hand of the LORD my God was on me, I took courage and gathered leading men from Israel to go up with me. (Ezra 7:28)

In the Hand of the Lord Part 1, we looked at how God’s hand was upon the life of Ezra and how Ezra studied God’s Law, obeyed it, and taught it as God’s ambassador to the people.  The hand of the Lord upon your life and mine makes all the difference of what kind of lives we will live.  We can only live one time, there are no do-overs in life.  We can change how we live from now on, but we can never go back and undue something that we did.  And since we can only live our lives one time, we need the hand of the Lord guiding our lives if we are to live it by His design.

Like Pinocchio no one wants to feel like a puppet.  However some feel, “If I submit to God, I’ll just become a puppet!”  Vonette Bright in her book Renew a Steadfast Spirit Within Me responds to this kind of think.  She writes, “A brilliant young man questioned Dr. Henrietta Mears about surrendering his life to God. He was convinced that becoming a Christian would mean the destruction of his personality, that he’d be altered in some strange way, and that he’d lose control of his own mind. He feared becoming a mere puppet in God’s hands.   “So Miss Mears asked him to watch as she turned on a lamp. One moment it was dark, then she turned on the switch. She explained, ‘The lamp surrendered itself to the electric current and light has filled the room. The lamp didn’t destroy its personality when it surrendered to the current. On the contrary-the very thing happened for which the lamp was created: it gave light.’”

Ezra submitted himself to the Hand of the Lord upon his life and he wasn’t a puppet that was forever to live a life of boredom under God’s control.  The very opposite was true.  Because God’s hand was upon Ezra’s life to great things took place.

First God “extended his good favor to me before the king and his advisers and all the king’s powerful officials.”  God brought Ezra into favor with the king and his advisors.  I shared in 2004 a message on how God can give you favor with the ungodly.  How else other than God’s hand being upon you can this happen.  When an ungodly person is against the God you serve, and His cause that you live for it is a God thing when you are brought into favor with such a person.  Secondly, King Artaxerxes had granted liberty to the Jews.  God’s hand brought courage to Ezra as well. Ezra would gather and lead the Israel to go with him back to Jerusalem to rebuild the temple and the city.  God’s hand is for leading us and as we submit to Him, He leads us in ways we would never have dreamed.  Paul tells us “No eye has seen, no ear has heard, no mind has conceived what God has prepared for those who love him.”  Ezra was leading God’s people in God’s way because God’s hand was leading Ezra.  When God’s hand is upon us there is no telling what He can do in us and through us.  Where do you see God leading you?  Do you know?  I’ve heard it said where God guides, God provides.

Application:  May you walk with the Hand of the Lord guiding you and be lead to foavor with the ungodly, and may He use you to lead others in the way of the Lord.

Until the nets are filled….Blessings, Pastor Phil

title.rendered: The Hand Of The Lord, by Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“…for the gracious hand of his God was on him. 10 For Ezra had devoted himself to the study and observance of the Law of the LORD, and to teaching its decrees and laws in Israel. (Ezra 7:9-10)

The book of Ezra whose name likely means, “The Lord Has Helped,” shares the life of Ezra who served as a priest and teacher, a man learned in matters concerning the commands and decrees of the LORD for Israel (7:11).  A key phrase in his book is “The Hand Of The Lord.”

When I think of the classic movie Pinocchio I remember the very lonely woodcarver, Geppato, makes a wooden boy (a marionette) which magically comes to life. Pinnocchio longs to be detached from his marionette strings and  wishes he could be a real, live boy and truly become Geppato’s son.

Like Pinocchio many want to live lives with no strings attached.  We don’t desire anyone to control our lives because we want to be at the controls.  However as a Christian God has cut the strings of our previous puppet master Satan from our lives.  Pinocchio eventually runs away to the Land of Toys with his friend, Lamp-Wick.  After five months of play, Pinocchio wakes up one fine morning and finds a great surprise awaiting him.  His ears have become like those of a Donkey.  In a little while he changes into a real Donkey and begins to bray Pinocchio, having become a Donkey, is bought by the owner of a Circus, who wants to teach him to do tricks. The Donkey becomes lame and is sold to a man who wants to use his skin for a drumhead.

Like Pinnochio we have the tendency to run into sin, even though God has cut the strings from the enemy from our lives.  The Apostle Paul said “What shall we say, then? Shall we go on sinning so that grace may increase? 2 By no means! We died to sin; how can we live in it any longer? It is for freedom that Christ has set us free. Stand firm, then, and do not let yourselves be burdened again by a yoke of slavery.  The thing that makes the difference once having the strings of bondage cut, is to stay in the boundaries that God sets for our lives, by letting him control our lives.  The repeated phrase “the hand of the Lord,” is what kept Ezra walking in righteousness before His Lord and God.  Because God’s hand was upon Ezra, Ezra prepared his heart to seek God’s law, and to do it, and to teach it.  God was Ezra’s authority and Ezra needed to make sure he pleased God just as you would like to please your employer.  So Ezra prepared his heart (mind) by looking at his job desricption in God’s Law to make sure he was fulfilling his priestly role in God’s way.  The desripction of Ezra’s tasks and attitude would be layed out in the Law of God.  Furthermore Ezra not only studied God’s law he did it.  James reminds us,  “Do not merely listen to the word, and so deceive yourselves. Do what it says.”  Satan is not moved by your reading, listening, singing, etc…, of God’s word, as long as you don’t obey it.  Obedience to god’s Word is what Satan hates by God loves.  Lastly Ezra went another step and taught God’s Word to Israel.  I imagine that Ezra and God desired that God’s hand wold be upon all Israel and therefore they needed to be instructed in God’s Law.  Ezra was a reader, doer and teacher of God’s Law and with God’s hand upon him was God’s ambassador to the people Israel.

May the Lord help us all to walk with His hand upon our lives, seek His Word, Obey His Word and teach His Word.
Until the nets are filled….Blessings Pastor Phil

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Matthew 21:23, Now when He came into the temple, the chief priests and the elders of the people confronted Him as He was teaching, and said, “By what authority are You doing these things? And who gave You this authority?”

Jesus had a way of dealing with people (His disciples, Pharisees, those who came to listen to Him preach). His way of responding to their questions was different. For those who wanted to know the truth, He was ready to answer but for those who were asking questions to find away to pin Him down, He would turn around and answer their question with a question. I don’t know about you but I don’t like asking a question only to be answered with another question.

The chief priests and the elders knew that Jesus was not doing anything of His own. He must have been sent, the authority He had (has) was not of Himself. Last week I took a team witnessing at a park, around 9pm a cop came over to ask everyone to leave the park. The reason we all obeyed his commands was because he had authority and all these could be reflected by his clothing, badge, the car he was driving. Had he come as an ordinary citizen without anything to show he was a man in authority, I don’t think any of us would have listened to him. Many listened to Jesus because He was a Man in authority and under authority. Instead of Jesus giving them an answer, he gave them a chance to answer their own question if they really cared to know 24 But Jesus answered and said to them, “I also will ask you one thing, which if you tell Me, I likewise will tell you by what authority I do these things: 25 The baptism of John–where was it from? From heaven or from men?”. Remember John had authority when he preached and baptized. No man had given him the authority but God from heaven. With Jesus asking them this question, He already knew their thoughts and this was to expose their evil motives. Vs 25, “And they reasoned among themselves, saying, “If we say, “From heaven,’ He will say to us, “Why then did you not believe him?’ 26 But if we say, “From men,’ we fear the multitude, for all count John as a prophet.” 27So they answered Jesus and said, “We do not know.” And He said to them, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things”. To me this means, if by now you do not know by what authority I am doing this, it’s not worth telling you.

Let’s look at a man who asked Jesus to exercise His authority , 5 …, a centurion came to Him, pleading with Him, 6 saying, “Lord, my servant is lying at home paralyzed, dreadfully tormented.” 7 And Jesus said to him, “I will come and heal him.”  8 The centurion answered and said, “Lord, I am not worthy that You should come under my roof. But only speak a word, and my servant will be healed. 9 For I also am a man under authority, having soldiers under me. And I say to this one, “Go,’ and he goes; and to another, “Come,’ and he comes; and to my servant, “Do this,’ and he does it.” 10 When Jesus heard it, He marveled, and said to those who followed, “Assuredly, I say to you, I have not found such great faith, not even in Israel. The centurion had his servants obey him because he had authority so he understood the power of authority, using what you’ve been given. Hasn’t Jesus also given us authority over the works of the enemy, so that when the devil comes and asks, by whose authority are we doing this, we can confidently say by the authority given to us by Jesus Christ. Sickness, lack, depression whatever it is can obey and leave because of that authority. If we came on our own, the enemy is ready to laugh at us, when we come in His name everything has no reason for not obeying. Instead of questioning His authority, we should exercise His authority. Blessings Ev

title.rendered: Serving with a Perfect Heart, By Pastor Phil

content.rendered: Good morning, “He did what was right in the sight of the Lord, but not with a perfect heart.” 2 Chronicles 25:2 When I think of the fifth commandment, “Honor our father and mother,” a scene comes to mind. I can picture the child that is asked to take out the garbage at a time he doesn’t feel like it. He gets up tears the garbage out of the can like he’s going to war, rips the door open, slams the garbage in the outside can, blasts the cover on that can, and slams the doors coming back in the house while gritting his teeth, complaining. Did the boy do what was right (obey), yes, however did he do it with a perfect heart (an honoring attitude), NO! Similarly Amaziah when about to go to war was instructed by the man of God to decrease the size of army and fire the 1,000 mercenaries from northern Israel that he had just paid and hired. Amaziah not understanding the ways of God could not initially reconcile in his mind how he could just throw his money away like that, and just let them go. The man of God instructed him that he is to go with his original 300,000 soldiers, because God was not with the 1,000 hired men. When you go to war, knowing your enemies verses your allies is crucial, and God has seen into the heart of these mercenaries. The man of God responded to the “wasted money” issue in Amaziah’s mind saying that God’s help is far more then that, because it is He that has the power to help or hurt Amaziah in the battle. Amaziah was optimistic and lead his troops as instructed and killed 10,000 men o Seir, while taking another 10,00 prisoners and then killing them as well. Upon returning to Judah, Amaziah found that the disgruntled mercenaries, that he fired, had ransacked and plundered the towns of Judah killing 3,000 people. Then the most ironic thing took place. Amaziah knowing that it was in obeying God that he had been victorious, returns to a pillaged Judah, and instead of seeking the Lord, he set up idols, gods that he had stolen from the men of Seir and worshipped them as his gods and burned incense to them. That leaves on scratching their hand in wonder does it not. God’s wrath was ignited and a prophet came and said, “Why do you consult this people’s gods, which could not save their own people from your hand?” However instead of this time yielding to the words of the prophet, his real heart came forth. Amaziah interrupted him saying, “Did I ask for your opinion? Shut up or get thrown out!” What a change in attitude. That prophet took the authority to give the final word saying, ““I know that God has determined to destroy you, because you have done this and have not listened to my counsel.” Amaziah was defeated and taken captive, and everything he had worked for was lost. Eventually he fled to Lachish where he was tracked down and killed. Jesus said apart from Me you can do nothing. Although Amaziah had one victory, he tried to be successful apart from honoring God with a perfect, undivided heart. He dishonoring, prideful attitude is what brought him to ruin and death. His downfall ALL hinged on his eventual turning away from God completely. It didn’t need to turn out that way. Making this your Prayer: Teach me your way, O LORD, and I will walk in your truth; give me an undivided heart, that I may fear your name (Psalm 86:11) Blessings Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
– is there someone, whom you regularly pray for ..
– someone, whom your hearts deeply / strongly feels for … someone you have a burden for …
– is there someone in your life, whom you are really concerned about ..
– in the middle of the night you wake up with a strong urge to pray …
– someone whom you love, with the love of the Lord … love inexplicable ..
– when you think of the person, your heart immediately gets filled with immense gladness .. he/she is a friend in the Lord ..
– all you need to do is think about that friend or friends, and you suddenly feel very very nice, about everything …
– its some what like the way David felt towards Jonathan .. remember their friendship… i think its awesome to have a friend like that … i am blessed with one myself! 🙂
– i am sure the Lord blessed us all with many many wonderful people in our lives …
– people who brought us up (parents/ guardians) .. people who taught us .. the ones who were our buddies … the ones who helped us by coming out of their way … the ones who played games with us … the ones who took care of our needs … the ones who paid our bills … the ones who prayed for us … could even be the ones who only smiled from their window or offered a lift to the bus stop … or that neighbour who brought you lunch, knowing that you were sick … how about that faithful retired uncle who waves without fail everyday and wishes good morning .. or his wife who never does …
– all you had to do was look around and you’d see so many people around .. so many different people … different in so many ways .. yet they are there … in your life … ! crossing your way every now and then …! influencing your thoughts / perspective / attitude / temper to some extent or the other …
– the same people whom the Lord loved .. just the way He loved you … the same love that compelled Him to come down and do what no one ever could possibly imagine … the greatest love that made Jesus, lay down His life for His friends – US!

Is there greater love ?
The answer is, there isn’t!

task :
how about doing a little something, NICE and SPECIAL …
it doesn’t have to involve anyone else … except you and Jesus …
think of any of those people, in your life …
and then lift them up in prayer … as the Spirit of the Lord leads …
i am sure there is somene out there (very much a part of your life), who needs prayer or a blessing or who knows what!
Jesus sure knows better …

title.rendered: #159 dial Canaan … if the lines not clear there always is Egypt

content.rendered:
-In todays world, there is a help desk for everything.
-There are online chat machines, talk shows, friendly talkers, dirty talkers. All you need to do is dial them and talk all that you want. If you were wondering, why would anyone want to do that … well guess what!  its a very well established and flourishing industry.
-Everyone needs someone to talk to. Every one, if not most of us need someone to share our stuff with… the others needn’t say anything or suggest or even feel for it – not a word. All they need to do is hea..r!
-We all need someone to hear, us! We all do! When we talk, we better have someone who is listening to us with all ears! It needn’t necessarily be our
verbal speech … it could be our actions that demand attention … or our behaviour that demands reciprocation, if not an audience!
-Some shout out to their God, in lonely corners, “God, send someone … for me to talk to” …
-A few cry out with to their hearts dearest, “all their troubles.. all their pain .. their anguish … saying there was no gain”
-Do they inturn expect their bewildered audiences to say something in return – may be not … they don’t need to … if they’ve heard you that’z good
enough .. that is all that was required … some one who could just listen to you … without asking any questions … someone who could Just LISTEN …

It appears as though, some kind of a burden impartation happens .. where to ? i don’t know … I’ve certainly heard them say, “i feel better after i’ve shared this with you.. i am not sure how the things are going to improve though..”

You may not find anything wrong with this … Before you confuse this with, sharing your problems with other bro’ and sis’ in Christ, as the Spirit leads  / or taking up spiritual / mental counselling with the elders or pastors in church … let me clarify, I am talking about cases where, we aren’t depending entirely on Jesus…! where Jesus isn’t anywhere in the picture…! where even though the Lord is consulted, He is later made a mere spectator ..! where in spite of the fact that, Jesus is working, we continue to tolerate lots of hurt and pain, which speaks for Lack of faith ..!
Why is it easy to cry out to a mortal man and not God?
Look at the bible … if you’ve read psalms, you will understand, what the psalmist did each time he was in trouble ..

– He cried out to the Lord, alone ..! the psalmist ran in to the inner courts of the KING, and took refuge .. he hid in the WINGS of the most HIGH..!
– well, David, sure had many wives … I am sure they were his friends too … why didn’t he go speak to them …!

Because, there is nothing that the MORTAL MAN can offer you..! Donot dial Canaan or Egypt! I was mocking! Instead call upon the name of the Lord!

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Habakkuk 1:5, “… For I will work a work in your days which ye will not believe, though it be told you”

“Oh Lord my God, when I’m in your awesome wonder, consider all the things thy hands have made, I see the stars, I hear thy roaring thunder, thy power through out the universe displayed. Then sings my soul, my Savior God to thee, How great thou art”

The hymn and the text above are eye openers to us as the hymn gives us a reference of what the Lord has done and the text lets us know what He is going to do in the days to come. Have you ever wondered whether God could do something in your life or around you? I know many who are still stuck in this place of ”CAN HE?” They are scared of praying because they don’t believe God can. I am in a place where I know HE CAN the only question is WILL HE what HE CAN? This has helped me to change even the way I pray because I don’t pray to God anymore about whether “HE CAN” that is settled, my question is will He do what He can. I used to get frustrated when I went before God because of those times I would go before Him and not get anything after I prayed. I got scared of going to ask Him anything but when He allowed me to see it differently, I started going to Him because He can whether He was going to do it or not was not question anymore, the question was did, did I trust Him enough to bring it to Him? The moment I come to Him, I know He can and believing Him causes me to know He will. The three Hebrew boys had something going on for them, they believed God could (CAN) deliver them from the fire, to them that was the main thing and they also believed that He would  (WILL) deliver them but they said that even if He does not, just believing that He could (CAN) was enough to cause them to stand. I’m not worried anymore about what He can do because the world is displaying what He has done and these things are great.

Are you getting frustrated that your prayers are not being answered, do you believe that He can? Are you going to Him because He can or just because of formality? Change the way you perceive how God operates, begin to believe that He can and then move to the realm of believing that He will and you will see how He will work a work in your days which ye will not believe, though it be told to you simply because He does exceeding abundantly above all we ask or imagine according to the power that works within us. Blessings Evans

content.rendered:
– i know where i am heading .. i also know God’s plan for me … i know exactly what i am going to do… for certain..!
– I have wisdom – substantial amounts of it [atleast that is what i think]
– I know i am diligent enough to take important decisions that have the potential to impact others … for their good i am sure!
– I am positive that i am mature enough to tell someone, what is right and what is not!
– or for that matter, i am mature enough to know how to behave with my friends … without offending any of them …
– i take good care of my finances … i manage it all pretty well … my investments / bonds / shares / for all taxation purposes, you could seek advise
from me … atleast i never had to go visit a tax consultant for advice ..
– i am great with my family, spouse, children … i am glad, that i am being a good husband to my wife … she looks upto me for complicated matters, and i
figure it out for her … i have a wonderful family …
– i have a great circle of friends … everybody loves me … they love hanging around with me … they like the way i talk, i walk ..boy, am i a style statement or
what!
– a few of them even hero worship me.. i think ..!
– i am in complete control of everything i do …if not complete, atleast to a great extent ..
– i maintain my relationships very well … anyone at anytime could take me for granted … i am an open book … out for everyone to see …which is why i think
everyone is so comfortable with me….
– i have my personal list of favourites … i usually am very particular about stuff …
– i have a great sense of control over all my relationships … with parents / siblings / friends- i believe i do! .. when things get challenging, i wouldn’t mind
going on my knees to make it up and it should be fine … for i love them all… and moreover they can take me for granted ..
– i know myself very well… you can take me for granted, and not regret …
– i have a soulmate … and i think i know just about everything about my soulmate … do i?

alright then, before you go crazy, let me explain what is it that i am trying to say … all the above said statements are stuff that you may have felt / believed in at any point of time in your lives… it may not sound harmful … but do you know something … there is something very dangerous about the whole thing … it is the number of time the word “I” is used …
– by nature we are self centered … you may never have realized it, but that is the truth … the self that was crucified when you accepted Jesus, is dying to come back to life 😉 … and has been successful often!

God cannot work in us, if we continue to depend upon ourselves… He will first take you … then….break you … till nothing of your self remains … and then He’s going to build you…! If you have a problem with that, than you are serving the wrong god!

title.rendered: Serving With Strong Hands, By Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“Be strong therefore, and let not your hands be weak for your work will be rewarded.” 2 Chronicles 15:7

Israel’s had been for a long season without the true God, and without a teaching priest, and without law.  And at this time Israel only sought God when trouble arose, and He was found of them.  Isn’t that just like people today to seek God when all else fails, and all resources are exhausted?  Perhaps you’ve been guilty in this area too.  Remember during 9/11 how the country began to pray and come together in the midst of turmoil and bewilderment.  Democrats and Republicans were holding hands in prayer together, families were praying together, and church attendance increased.  However what happened when the feeling of threat, and terrorism died out, so did those that were only seeking God during the tragedy die out.  Their hands proved to be weak.

I believe strong hands are praying hands.  Jesus said that His house would be a house of prayer (Mt. 21:13).  Paul said in 1 Cor. 3:16, “Don’t you know that you yourselves are God’s temple and that God’s Spirit lives in you?  We are to be the prayer house for Christ by the indwelling Holy Spirit, and serve Him with strong hands. Zechariah prophesied, “This is what the LORD Almighty says: “You who now hear these words spoken by the prophets who were there when the foundation was laid for the house of the LORD Almighty, let your hands be strong so that the temple may be built.  We are the New Testament Temple, wherein God’s Holy Presence (the Holy Spirit) abides.  Paul speaks of putting on the armor of God in Eph. 6, to battle spiritually in PRAYER (v. 18)!  The Psalmist wrote, “BLESSED be the LORD my strength which teaches my hands to war, and my fingers to fight (Psa. 144:1).”  We need to be taught to have strong hands for war in the spiritual, just as a physical military soldier is taught war tactics, because the fight is “‘Not by might nor by power, but by my Spirit,’ says the LORD Almighty.”  Let’s stop using our arguing mouths or the latest Christian book out there, but by the Living Book (His Word), and through His directive prayer, and in the Power of the Holy Spirit we engage prayer.  Jude wrote, “But you, dear friends, build yourselves up in your most holy faith and pray in the Holy Spirit.”  The Holy Spirit knows how to empower us with strong hands in prayer when we let go of control.  Just think how much we always want a handle on things, because we yearn for control of everything, even that which is outside of our control.  Perhaps this is why so many waste time in the area of worry that Evans shared on yesterday.

In this area, it’s not mom that knows best, but the Holy Spirit that knows best.  “In the same way, the Spirit helps us in our weakness. We do not know what we ought to pray for, but the Spirit himself intercedes for us with groans that words cannot express. And he who searches our hearts knows the mind of the Spirit, because the Spirit intercedes for the saints in accordance with God’s will.”  God’s desire is for us all to have strong hands in prayer, and allow the Holy Spirit to help us in prayer, because He knows the mind and will of God better then we do.  When we have strong hands in prayer God’s promise is that our work (because prayer is hard work, see Dan 10:20) will be rewarded by God.  Therefore if we are not praying, we are living PRAYLESS lives, can we even expect such an insult to God to be rewarded, I say not!  We need to actively, diligently, and fervently pray now.  We need to be too busy NOT too pray, for when we work, we work, but when we pray God work!

Until the nets are filled….Blessings, Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Our wants and needs are peculiar … they seem important … And they are important.. yes!

Peace… job satisfaction … friends … joy unconditional … provisions … promotion… project sign off .. pending appraisal … missing arrears … boss’ transfer… sisters marriage… brothers job .. healing from dreadful diseases… disputes to be settled … loan approvals … a pair of new trousers … sports shoes … blah blah blah …

-the list can be as diverse as it can get …
-you may think no one realizes the importance of your need being met, more than you yourself!
-you might have lifted your need in prayer a zillion times – and have asked many others to also pray
-but nothing seems to be coming up ..
-where ever you are, the need keeps coming back to you like a nightmare, reminding you of the miserable state
you are in without it being met..
-you may even be a little frustrated as to why God is delaying your answer …
-you try erasing the need from your mind …
-you also try and think of something else to keep away from it coming back …
-and then you even begin to hold a grudge against God for not answering your prayer your way…!
-if not outright you tend feel that way for a long time…

Alright – check this out!
If there is anyone who is capable of doing mistakes all the time, its you and I. Not God!
If there is anyone who is capable of doing RIGHT things all the time, its God. Not us!

The truth is, I don’t need to feel nice about something to understand that it is God’s plan for me!
I don’t need anything to get going with life, more than I need HIM.
If you’ve got Jesus, you’ve got it all!
Jesus is all that you need!

so please seek Jesus and His kingdom … the rest isn’t more important than HIM!

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Genesis 12:1, “Now the LORD had said to Abram: “Get out of your country, From your family And from your father’s house, To a land that I will show you”

Do keep me in your prayers as I continue to teach on prayers this Saturday at pastor Phil’s church, also I have been invited to speak at a church (Indian Congregation) in Danbury during youth Sunday, please pray. God has given me favor with this church in Danbury and I am excited about the opportunity. Now back to the word.

In as much as I like to drive places, one of my favorite means of traveling is flying. Every time I go through the checking point, I tend to have more than one luggage. Very heavy luggage dragging it to the checking point and the thing that relieves me the most is when they say, “Sir, would you like to check in your luggage?”  As usual I say, “yes please” because I like to travel light. I hate dragging luggage into the plane, trying to find a spot for them or dragging them around if I have a connecting flight.

In life we often run around dragging baggage (stuffs) the Lord is asking us, “sir/maam, would you like to check in your baggage”?. It’s like the Lord saying, “Please let me worry about the safety and the destination of your baggage and you can travel light”. The neat thing about checking in your luggage, you don’t worry much, yes you think about it but you don’t worry about it because you know it will arrive. Yes a few times you hear of luggage misplaced but hard to hear a luggage got lost.

When the Lord told Abram to move to a land He would show him, I bet Abram had a lot of things in his mind that qualified as baggage such as fear, anxiety, doubts, and what ifs. We do the same many times, worry about how our lives will turn out, our children, where they go, who they hang out with, worrying about who they will marry. On the other hand, you are worried about your marriage or whoever you will marry, worried if you are making the right decisions, worried about your health etc. Some even worry about worry itself and to be honest, worry is a killer. Abram believed God, checked in all the baggage he had and traveled light. Vs 5, Then Abram took Sarai his wife and Lot his brother’s son, and all their possessions that they had gathered, and the people whom they had acquired in Haran, and they departed to go to the land of Canaan. So they came to the land of Canaan”. We too have an opportunity in this life to travel light knowing God will take care of us. You got to have faith that the Lord is able to carry your baggage while you sleep peacefully in the plane. Well, you might try doing what one fellow did. He worried so much that he decided to hire someone to do his worrying for him. He found a man who agreed to be his hired worrier for a salary of $200,000 per year. After the man accepted the job, his first question to his boss was, “Where are you going to get the $200,000 per year to pay me?” To which the boss replied, “I don’t know. That’s your worry.” God will not charge you for taking your worries, He wants you traveling light because He cares for you and wants to take care of you. I remember this hymn, Be not dismayed whate’er betide, God will take care of you; beneath his wings of love abide, God will take care of you. Chorus God will take care of you, through every day, o’er all the way; he will take care of you, God will take care of you. Trust the Lord, check in all your baggage through prayer and travel light. Blessings Ev

title.rendered: I Will Not Leave, By Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“Elijah said to Elisha, “Stay here; the LORD has sent me to Bethel.” But Elisha said, “As surely as the LORD lives and as you live, I will not leave you.” So they went down to Bethel.” 2 Kings 2:2

It’s been said, that some people only come into our lives for a reason and a season.  Years back I had a youth pastor friend of mine at my first church.  I loved this guy so much, that when I was I school, the moment the bell rang, most days I would go to the church to hang out with him.  God used him to stir the gifts of God in my life.  He was more then just a youth pastor to me, but my deeply loved spiritual mentor.  However there came a day when he would leave.  My heart was broken and I had many unanswered questions, but the fact remained that he was gone.  Man that time hurt a lot

Similarly, the Prophet Elijah would be the spiritual mentor to his success Elisha.  Elisha would leave everything and follow Elijah (1 Kings 19).  However there would come a time when Elijah would also depart from Elisha.  During this time “The company of the prophets at Bethel came out to Elisha and asked, “Do you know that the LORD is going to take your master from you today “Yes, I know,” Elisha replied, “but do not speak of it.”2Ki 2:3?”  Elisha knew what was coming and didn’t want to hear of it from everyone, because he was so very close to Elijah.   Elijah said to Elisha on Elijah’s way to Bethel, “Stay here; the Lord has sent me to Bethel.”  However Elisha replied, “As surely as the LORD lives and as you live I will NOT leaven you.”  So together they went to Bethel.  This scenario played out again when Elijah was called to Jericho.  And again he told Elisha to stay and again Elisha refused to stay saying, “As surely as the LORD lives and as you live, I will not leave you.”  And if that wasn’t enough it happened a third time when God called Elijah to Jordan.  And again Elisha replied, “As surely as the LORD lives and as you live, I will not leave you.”  However the time would come when suddenly, as the two walked and talked together, a fiery chariot swooped between them and took Elijah in wind up into heaven (v.11). It was over in an instant. Elisha could but cry out in amazed tribute to his departed master-(v.12). Elijah was gone, although Elisha promised he would never leave his master, his master left him, and where he went Elisha could not go at this time, a separation was inevitable.

Elisha would now take up Elijah’s mantle (his cloak) which represented Elisha’s transition to chief Prophetic Service in his masters’ absence.  Elisha asked (v.14) “Where is the Lord God of Elijah?”  Elisha did not have Elijah with him, but he still needed God to be with him Elisha exercised the requested double portion (v.9) of Elijah’s spirit upon Elisha’s life, as  Elisha took up the mantle and did his first miracle of parting the waters (v.14) just as his master had done (v.8).  Elisha needed God to be with him always not Elijah.  God would say to Joshua “As I was with Moses, so I will be with you; I will never leave you nor forsake you.”  The apostle Paul wrote, “And if the Spirit of him who raised Jesus from the dead is living in you, he who raised Christ from the dead will also give life to your mortal bodies through his Spirit, who lives in you.”  And Christ I have all the power of heaven and earth therefore go and make disciples of all nations and surely I am with you always, to the very end of the age.  We need to know some will leave us, but the spirit of God in the life of the Christian never will as he stays in the presence of the Master.  Thank Him for those that have taught you, and perhaps have left you with valuable training, but thank the Lord for His promise to never leave or forsake you as you do His work, and follow His blueprints. Blessings, Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Esther 4:14, “… Yet who knows whether you have come to the kingdom for such a time as this?”

We know of opportunities that present themselves when least expected. At the very moment they present themselves, you weigh the possibilities of being the person to rise to the occasion while looking at who you are. I watched a comedy where this young man was afraid of swimming, he did not feel he could do it because he was just too terrified. On one particular day, he saw this girl fall in the pool drowning, he swallowed his fears and jumped into the pool to rescue the girl not knowing that he had fears before. But for a moment of time, he stepped into the occasion and did what he was afraid to do so as to rescue someone else.

Esther found herself in a position of diving into the deep end to rescue the Jews who were about to be destroyed by Haman. She is the queen as we know, feeling safe but her people were not safe. Though Mordecai knew her niece was the queen and he could get whatever he might have wanted, his desire was to see all the Jews free. Of course we can now see that his fighting for Esther to be the queen was not just for Esther alone but for the Jews. But for a moment she  has an opportunity to rise to the occasion to rescue the Jews even if it means perishing. Esther is being reminded that if she does not do it, there will still be deliverance for the Jews some how yet who knows whether she has come to the kingdom for such a time as this. Have you ever asked yourself why you are where you are for such a time as this? I don’t believe it was by coincident. Have you asked yourself why what you’ve been afraid to face present themselves and you either have to let them drown or jump to rescue because you have swallowed your fears? That job, ministry or calling you were afraid to step into because you were afraid you could not do it, for such a time as this, you’ve been presented with an opportunity. I believe that there are certain things you will never fully know you can do till you swallow your fears and jump to the deep end only to find you can swim.

Upon being challenged by Mordecai, she sees that at the moment the fate of the Jews will based on the decisions she makes. Note something here, she is not known as a Jew to the king yet, neither is anyone allowed to present themselves before the king without being called. Appearing before this king without being summoned called for death and here is her response to Mordecai “16”Go, gather all the Jews who are present in Shushan, and fast for me; … My maids and I will fast likewise. And so I will go to the king, which is against the law; and if I perish, I perish!” A young queen ready to lay her new career on the line. Ready to face her fears for the sake of her people. Ready to jump to the deep end. The moment she was ready to let go, God granted her favor with the king. When we are ready to loose it at a given moment that is when we find it. Great decision by Esther, great rescue for the Jews. You are where you are for such a time as this, ask the Lord to show you what you could do at a given moment to make a difference, swallow your fears and jump to the deep end.
Blessings Ev

content.rendered:
Who hasn’t heard the word! I doubt if there is any who hasn’t. At least my personal favourite in usage is, “devil, I rebuke you in Jesus’ name”
Most of us associate the word with admonishment / correction. Lets look at the dictionary ..
Rebuke:
1.To criticize or reprove sharply; reprimand.
2.To check or repress.
n. A sharp reproof.
verb. To criticize for a fault or an offense: admonish. call down.
noun.Words expressive of strong disapproval: Admonishment.
The noun rebuke has one meaning: an act or expression of criticism and censure.
The verb rebuke has one meaning: censure severely or angrily.
synonyms : rag, trounce, reproof, lecture, reprimand, jaw, dressdown, scold, chide, berate, bawlout, remonstrate, chewout, chewup, have words, lambaste, lambast.

Thank you for being patient with me. I wanted us all to understand the word real well, before I went ahead with I had to say…
Now, here’s a question! Have you ever been rebuked? It Could be your parents, siblings, teachers, friends, neighbours, colleagues, bosses, GOD Himself!
I am sure all of us have faced rebuke in our lives at some point or the other…
SO, What do you do, when faced with rebuke?
– well, it isn’t obviously a pleasant/comfortable situation, to be in…
– it has been called for with or without your realization …
– the person rebuking you has definitely been displeased / offended / hurt / disgraced by you
– and you are the reason why it is… [which ever way, it is YOU]
– the person rebuking you is NOW concerned and is doing the right thing by approaching you …
– time has been dedicatedly spent by the person in analysing you and your behaviour, before the rebuke is given …
– and above all Jesus is allowing it…

SO, What should your attitude be ?
– Jesus like, of course!
– First things first, for heavens sake, please donot resurrect your crucified self!
– whatever you do, donot take the rebuke personally .. you cannot afford to!
– it was originally meant for your personal edification .. donot do anything stupid to hinder that!
– pay close attention to what is being said / noted / observed / pointed ..
– donot rightaway jump into a justification mode – be still and pay attention!
– carefully pick up all your developmental needs – you need to be sensitive to His HOLY SPIRIT here!
– humble yourself and apologize to the person – truly meaning every word of it ..! try and make it up!
– lastly, in no other sense, give thankz to Jesus for the circumstance!

And you’ll be fine! Trust me! You’d have made Jesus proud!

p.s. please continue to pray for me and His ministry.. need all the prayers I can get.

content.rendered:
Good morning:

“Then David said, “No one but the Levites may carry the ark of God, because the LORD chose them to carry the ark of the LORD and to minister before him forever.”
1Chronicles 15:2

You’ve heard it said, when all else fails read the instructions.  God has given us His divine instructions within the Scriptures.  However, many act independently of God’s design and are upset when it doesn’t return with God’s blessing.  If we want His blessing, we must follow His blueprints.  Adam was told not eat from the tree of the knowledge of good and evil, because he would die (God’s blueprints).  Adam and Eve would later dine on the forbidden fruit.  In Num. 20:8, God told Moses speak to the rock (God’s blueprints), but in Moses’ anger he struck the rock (Moses blueprints).  Let me now draw your attention to the story surrounding the Scripture above, and look at the failure of following God’s blueprints. 

The Ark of the Covenant was the golden chest housing the Two Stone Tablets of the Law – Ten Commandments, Aaron’s rod that budded, and the golden pot of ‘hidden’ manna.  The Scriptures say in 2 Sam. 6, and 1 Chron. 13 that “They moved the Ark of God from Abinadab’s house on a new cart, with Uzzah and Ahio guiding it.  When they came to the threshing floor of Nacon, Uzzah reached out and took hold of the ark of God, because the oxen stumbled.  The LORD’S anger burned against Uzzah, and he struck him down because he had put his hand on the ark,   So he died there before God, because, “because of his irreverent act.” Since Uzzah was the one God struck, he must be the one that did not follow God’s blueprints and paid dearly for it.  RC Sproul writes that Uzzah’s reaction was instinctive.  He did what any pious Jew would do to keep the ark from falling into the mud, trying to stop the holy object from getting muddied.  It was not a premeditated act of defiance against God, but a reflex action.  Looking from hindsight his attempt seemed heroic.  God didn’t speak blessing upon him from heaven, but rather slaughtered him on the spot.  Is that not a bit harsh?  The Levites were the only ones consecrated to carry the Ark by the blueprints.  Whenever the Ark was to be transported the Levites had to insert the poles into the rings, not even touching the Ark directly themselves.  No provision was made by God for those hurrying the procedure by using an oxcart.  His blueprints were known!  

Many are offended by God’s slaughtering of Uzzah, because we so easily follow our own blueprints, and are not struck down for it.  God gave divine justice to Uzzah, as he acted presumptuously thinking his hand was less polluted then the mud.  Sin is cosmic treason against a perfectly pure Sovereign.  David was angry because the LORD’S wrath had broken out against Uzzah, but David quickly went back to God’s blueprints to transport the Ark proclaiming, “No one but the Levites may carry the ark of God, because the LORD chose them to carry the ark of the LORD and to minister before him forever.”  Let’s learn from their sin, and follow the blueprints first off (i.e. marriageàsexual intimacyàchildren).  Solomon said it like this, “Fear God and keep his commandments (blueprints).  God gives commandments not suggestions.  Whose blueprints are you following?  

Blessings Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Esther 4:1-17, 9 The girl pleased him and won his favor.”(NIV).

I am a firm believer of kingdom principles. If you careful look at how good things happen on a day to day basis, you can trace some attributes back to God’s kingdom principles applied knowingly or unknowingly. For today I would like to take a principal from the book of Esther and apply it to our day to day life. I had a different direction to go with the book but I am prompted to approach it from another angle.

If you look at an job ad or if someone tells you of an opening, there are things you look at such as, the job, the requirements, the benefits etc, then you decide whether you are going for the job or not. We are told in the book of Esther that there was a job opening for the next queen. If you’ve read the book of Esther, you will find that the queen’s position was vacant because queen Vashti disobeyed the king and was dropped from her position. The ad for the position was to find a beautiful young virgin, and the one who pleased the king would be the next queen. We see this in the first 4 verses and then the scripture switches to concentrate on someone by the name of Mordecai who happens to be a Jew carried away captive from Jerusalem. He has his niece Esther whose parents died awhile ago and Mordecai took her as his daughter. Vs 5. “…The young woman (Esther) was lovely and beautiful”. Mordecai hears about the ad and feels her niece is qualified for the job. Yes she is a slave girl, does not even deserve to be recognized yet that is not a stop to what she can be. The kingdom principle teaches us that God has not put limitations in our lives, we are the ones who put limitations in what we can be or do. It’s our attitude that leads us to where we can go. The bible says, “Proverbs 23:7, “For as he thinks in his heart, so is he…”. How many leave defeated lives though qualified because they have chosen to limit themselves. Many will stand before God one day and be showed what they could have been but because they never believed in themselves through God, they missed a lot.

It’s one thing to have the qualifications, it’s another thing to be the man or woman right for the job. Vs 8. “When the king’s order and edict had been proclaimed, many girls were brought to the citadel of Susa …. Esther also was taken ….. 9 The girl pleased him and won his favor.”(NIV). You know what fascinates me about this verse, many were called who had qualifications, only one was chosen. The beautiful slave girl. What made her different, she was able to sell herself. In job interviews, your qualifications allow you to be called for an interview, you now have to prove to the interviewer why you are the man or the woman for the job. You have to sell yourself. David before facing Goliath had to prove to Saul why he was the man for the job. At least for him he did not have the qualifications but still convinced the king by talking about his past successes. Remember the book of Esther has no name “God” in it but you can see the kingdom principles. You can go to an interview and not mention the name of God but apply the kingdom principles for you know who is backing you up in that interview. So many beautiful girls but one pleased the king and WON his favor. It does not say “she found favor but WON. This to means, she did something more than what the other girls did, she did sell herself through character, humility, hard work, charming, lovely. A slave girl encouraged to make one move and that changes her life completely, it was but for a moment for something this big to happen. To continue… Have you limited yourself? Have you ever thought about selling yourself? Blessings Ev

We did a 5 part series on the book of Esther a few years ago. ONE of the best devotions the Lord ever allowed me to put together (I mean it). If you would like to read them, let me know.

title.rendered: The Role of Our Enemies, By Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“You have heard that it has been said, You shall love your neighbour, and hate your enemy “But I say to you, Love your enemies, bless them that curse you, do good to them that hate you, and pray for them which despitefully use you, and persecute you;”  (Matt 5:43-44)   See Full passage (Matt 5:43-48)

I believe that each one of us has people in our lives that are enemies.  Who are the people in your life that seek your demise, hate when you move forward in life, try to get on your last nerve, and are vindictive and outright cruel to you?  I gather that some name(s) just surfaced in your mind rather quickly.  These enemies play a vital role in your life of you becoming more like Christ.  God sent us an example (John 13:15) in His Son, that we should be conformed to His image (Rom 8:29) and walk as Jesus walked (1 John 2:6).  What does any of this have to do with your enemies helping you to become more like Christ? 

Jesus pointed out that we are to love, bless, do good to, and pray for our enemies.  “If we want to make a difference we must be different.”  Jesus continues by saying, “For if you love them which love you, what reward have you? do not even the publicans the same? And if you salute your brethren only, what do you more than others? do not even the publicans so?”  The essence of what Jesus is saying is that if you follow Me (Jesus) and you treat your enemies the same way the world does how can you rightly say you are a Christian? 

Acts 6-7 tells the account of Stephen.  He rehearsed the history of Israel to his Hellenistic compatriots that were disputing with him (6:9) showing themselves to be his enemies.  Stephen “pushed the envelope” hard when he said to them, “Was there ever a prophet your fathers did not persecute? They even killed those who predicted the coming of the Righteous One. And now you have betrayed and murdered him-you who have received the law that was put into effect through angels but have not obeyed it.”  The truth hurt!  “Upon hearing these things, were cut to the heart, and they gnashed on him with their teeth.”  And as these men ran upon Stephen to stone him, Stephen looked up steadfastly into heaven and saw Jesus standing NOT sitting on the right hand of God.  As he is about to breathe his last breath he says, “Lord Jesus, receive my spirit”…and cried with a loud voice, “Lord, lay not this sin to their charge.”  Wow, Stephen has become so much like Christ in dealing with his enemies that his last dying words paralleled and were almost identical with Christ’s and certainly in the same Spirit of our LORD (Luke 23:34).  Read the gospels and examine how Jesus responded to his enemy Judas, to the point of allowing Judas to betray him with a kiss.  Wow!  Even as Christ was being verbally and physically abused He still died for sinners. 

Your response to your enemies speaks volumes of how Christ-like you are?  How do you treat the Judas’ in your life?  Is it like our Master, or like our previous father, the devil?  If you don’t treat your enemies any different then the world does, then you are acting like your enemies.  Ouch!  When dealing with your enemies, show them Christ’s love, share the gospel with them.  When they curse you, bless them.  When they show you hatred, purposefully be and do good unto them.  At the time they persecute you and despitefully use you, pray for them.  Proverbs says “If your enemy is hungry, give him food to eat; if he is thirsty, give him water to drink. In doing this, you will heap burning coals on his head, and the LORD will reward you.  This is “godly revenge!”  

Oh Lord, may we bless, pray for and show kindness and love to those who are our enemies and those who are yours, in response to their treatment toward us . 

Blessings Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“You have heard that it has been said, You shall love your neighbour, and hate your enemy “But I say to you, Love your enemies, bless them that curse you, do good to them that hate you, and pray for them which despitefully use you, and persecute you;”  (Matt 5:43-44)   See Full passage (Matt 5:43-48)

I believe that each one of us has people in our lives that are enemies.  Who are the people in your life that seek your demise, hate when you move forward in life, try to get on your last nerve, and are vindictive and outright cruel to you?  I gather that some name(s) just surfaced in your mind rather quickly.  These enemies play a vital role in your life of you becoming more like Christ.  God sent us an example (John 13:15) in His Son, that we should be conformed to His image (Rom 8:29) and walk as Jesus walked (1 John 2:6).  What does any of this have to do with your enemies helping you to become more like Christ?

Jesus pointed out that we are to love, bless, do good to, and pray for our enemies.  “If we want to make a difference we must be different.”  Jesus continues by saying, “For if you love them which love you, what reward have you? do not even the publicans the same? And if you salute your brethren only, what do you more than others? do not even the publicans so?”  The essence of what Jesus is saying is that if you follow Me (Jesus) and you treat your enemies the same way the world does how can you rightly say you are a Christian?

Acts 6-7 tells the account of Stephen.  He rehearsed the history of Israel to his Hellenistic compatriots that were disputing with him (6:9) showing themselves to be his enemies.  Stephen “pushed the envelope” hard when he said to them, “Was there ever a prophet your fathers did not persecute? They even killed those who predicted the coming of the Righteous One. And now you have betrayed and murdered him-you who have received the law that was put into effect through angels but have not obeyed it.”  The truth hurt!  “Upon hearing these things, were cut to the heart, and they gnashed on him with their teeth.”  And as these men ran upon Stephen to stone him, Stephen looked up steadfastly into heaven and saw Jesus standing NOT sitting on the right hand of God.  As he is about to breathe his last breath he says, “Lord Jesus, receive my spirit”…and cried with a loud voice, “Lord, lay not this sin to their charge.”  Wow, Stephen has become so much like Christ in dealing with his enemies that his last dying words paralleled and were almost identical with Christ’s and certainly in the same Spirit of our LORD (Luke 23:34).  Read the gospels and examine how Jesus responded to his enemy Judas, to the point of allowing Judas to betray him with a kiss.  Wow!  Even as Christ was being verbally and physically abused He still died for sinners.

Your response to your enemies speaks volumes of how Christ-like you are?  How do you treat the Judas’ in your life?  Is it like our Master, or like our previous father, the devil?  If you don’t treat your enemies any different then the world does, then you are acting like your enemies.  Ouch!  When dealing with your enemies, show them Christ’s love, share the gospel with them.  When they curse you, bless them.  When they show you hatred, purposefully be and do good unto them.  At the time they persecute you and despitefully use you, pray for them.  Proverbs says “If your enemy is hungry, give him food to eat; if he is thirsty, give him water to drink. In doing this, you will heap burning coals on his head, and the LORD will reward you.  This is “godly revenge!”

Oh Lord, may we bless, pray for and show kindness and love to those who are our enemies and those who are yours, in response to their treatment toward us .  Blessings Pastor Phi

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Colossians 3:23, “And whatever you do, do it heartily, as to the Lord and not to men”

Understanding the order of things should drive how we handle things. There is always a continuous battle on how we do things especially in the job set up. We need to understand that where we are number one it’s God who brought us there and not our education or ability. If you think about it, how many have more degrees than a thermometer and yet are still struggling to find a place to put those degrees to work. We have to come to grips with the truth that we are where we are because of God and this leads us to have a sense of humility for He is the boss. I feel like we tend to forget that our employer is God and through our earthly employers is where He fulfils His plans and purpose, that is part of where His character shines because He has His ambassadors representing Him in the job set up. God is the SOURCE, our earthly employers are the MEANS.

If we can distinguish between the Source and the means, then we are channeled to look and deal with things differently. I can therefore work hard in the job He has placed me knowing that He is my employer. I can be faithful with little or much knowing that He knows why He has placed me there. Taking ownership by understanding you are out to please the Lord in the job that He has placed you in. Colossians 3:23, “And whatever you do, do it heartily, as to the Lord and not to men”. I look at the last part of this scripture and it says AS TO THE LORD which to me means, how you would treat the Lord is how you would treat your boss, you are doing it unto the Lord through them. I know there are some who are not happy with their jobs and their bosses and just like Joseph who did not have his dream job but where he was was a preparation to where God would move him too. His qualification for the next move was in his hard work,  obedience and faithfulness in what he was doing. Moses was reduced from a prince in Egypt to a shepherd but you can see his faithfulness that channeled him to be elevated in due time to be a leader of millions. I believe God allows us to be in certain jobs not as a punishment but training grounds for character enlargement. A place to learn obedience and faithfulness. You can be faithful where you are as you trust God where you want to be.

The bible says in Colossians 3:22, “Bondservants, obey in all things your masters according to the flesh, not with eyeservice, as men-pleasers, but in sincerity of heart, fearing God”. How would we please a boss we cannot see without pleasing the boss we can see. If we know we are pleasing a boss we can see to please the boss we can’t see then our attitude towards work will be different. We will not slack, steal time, be careless or be lazy because we are not where we want to be. The scripture says, obey in ALL things but not please them when they are looking or when you can see what you will get out of it but with sincere heart, fearing God. This is pleasing to the Lord. I believe there are days we mess our progress to greater levels because of our attitudes towards work and our bosses. Ask yourself this question, why are you in your job? Why do you do what you do? Who do you do it for? Do an attitude check, see what changes you need to make and be the best worker the Lord wants you to be, you are His ambassador in that company.

Blessings Evans, God’s servant.

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Revelation 1:18, ” I am He that liveth, and was dead; and, behold, I am alive for evermore, Amen; and have the keys of hell and of death”.

It’s humility that caused Jesus to die and someone said, “Humility is not sign of weakness and meekness is strength under control”. He chose to do it for John 12:24, says “Unless the grain of wheat falls into the ground and dies, it abides alone but if it dies, it will be able to bare much fruit”, His humility was to eventually help bare much fruit and though He understood that many would leave Him by Himself, He says the grain of wheat has to die and abide alone. We as believers at one point in our lives we’ll encounter with the same truth falling in the ground and abiding alone. It’s easy to stand and have people around you to support you but fall and see people’s reactions, some will stop believing in you, hanging out with you and start talking about your failure and the list goes on. They will be too quick to pass a judgment that you failed and it’s over, they failed to stick around for long to know that your going down did not mean it was over, your going down was a preparation for your coming up. Jesus had to go down first that in due season He could go up yet He did not fail though it seamed like according to everyone including the devil. Ephesians 4:8 Wherefore he saith, When he ascended up on high, he led captivity captive, and gave gifts unto men. 9 (Now that he ascended, what is it but that he also descended first into the lower parts of the earth (which is hell)? 10 He that descended is the same also that ascended up far above all heavens, that He might fill all things.) People mostly concentrate on the part of going down, falling, dying and that is okay but wait till you see me rise again, resurrect for that will be the greatest accomplishment. In as much as we do not want to fall and yet we will fall, that is not a sign of failure,  the sign of failure is when you have fallen and you are doing nothing about your failure. It’s when you begin to look at your failure as a bridge to allow God to resurrect you that causes you to pump life inside you and know that you will be broken, fail, and be alone but if you know your third day is coming, you will await for the resurrection for if Jesus died and rose, and everything that He did was to get you and I ready for the same things, we can go through it if it’s going to get us to the next level. God raised Jesus from the dead, we too shall be raised from any kind of death we find ourselves.

Revelation 1:18, ” I am He that liveth, and was dead; and, behold, I am alive for evermore, Amen; and have the keys of hell and of death”. Don’t you love the way Jesus talks, He says I am He that lives and just a reminder, I was dead at one point and if that is not enough, I am not alive temporarily but forever more. He talks more about His life more than His death and He speaks of victory. It’s like, “you saw me die, that is good but did you see me rise? If you saw me die but never saw me rise, then you will be stuck in my death but when you see me rise then you will know our God gives second chances. As long as the past failures, brokenness and death are alive, the future is dead but the moment the past failure, death and brokenness and left in the grave, your future becomes vibrant for it’s not about past tense (used to) but present tense (now I am).

Many saw Jesus die and to some that marked the end but when He came back to life, no one was there to witness yet He said that He would rise again on the third day. Many will see you go down and that is where they will dismiss you, but they will miss the opportunity of seeing you rise again. I pray that you will see yourself rising again on your third day for you are what you confess. In Proverbs it says as a man thinks in his heart, so is he”. I know you saw me go down, did you stick around to see me rise?
Blessings Evans

title.rendered: Jesus “the wedge of exposure” By Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“Then the whole town went out to meet Jesus. And when they saw him, they pleaded with him to leave their region.” (Matt. 8:34)

On what grounds would you reject Jesus?  In the Scriptures Jesus was rejected many times by people because He stood in the way of what they were doing. Picture if the cranks of a machine or turning in a certain flow, and then you place a wedge within the cranks to stop the flow.  Jesus wedged Himself in the flow of people’s lifestyles, choices and actions.  He went to the region of the Gadarenes where He met two demonized coming from the tombs.  They were such violent men that when other met them they could not pass by these men.  Although this was the first time these men met Jesus, the demons within these men were well aquatinted with the Lord as they cried out from within, “[are you the] Son of God?” Have you come here to torture us before the appointed time?”  Jesus commanded these spirits, “‘Go,’ so they came out and went into the pigs, and the whole herd rushed down the steep bank into the lake and died in the water.”

Jesus showed His divine power over darkness and His compassion toward the two demonized men.  Christ was a wedge in the flow of darkness over their lives.  Although these two lives were saved that day, not all the men of the region were happy about this.  “Those tending the pigs ran off, went into the town and reported all this, including what had happened to the demon-possessed men.” The pig owners broadcast the news of what Jesus did, and an unimaginable response from the people took place.  Jesus was not met with thanks and gratitude as one would think after saving lives.  No, he was asked to take the “exit door” out of their area immediately.  Jesus can’t help but to walk in His mission to seek and save the lost, and to set the captives free!  The leaders of the rejection campaign against Jesus were none other then the pig owners.  Why?  Because Jesus was a wedge in their lives as well, as their livestock, their income, ran off a cliff to their death. The herdsmen rallied the people to tell Christ to leave the region, because their livestock was “living money.” 

These people valued things/money (livestock) more then people, which shows the hidden sickness of their hearts as opposed to the outward sickness in the lives of the demonized men.  “The loss of the herd became a way of exposing the real values of the people in the vicinity. They preferred pigs to persons, swine to the Savior (EBC).”  Pigs wallow in mud to cool their flesh, and the townspeople desired Jesus to leave so they can wallow in the covetous greed of their sinful flsh (hearts) without interruption by Jesus “the wedge of exposure”.  

When we see Christ triumph over darkness we should rejoice, and be open His convicting and removing sin in our lives.  If you ask Him to leave you now, He may ask you to leave Him on Judgment Day (Mat 7:21-23), is that worth it?   

Application:  Under what circumstance would you ask Jesus to leave you? Perhaps watching TV, in relationships, at work, at home are times you ask Jesus to leave, but it’s not worth it.  Read and meditate on Psalm 139. 

Blessings Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

John 5:1-15, vs. 6 “…, “Do you want to be made well?”

There are so many sickness in the world today. Some have been given some very difficult names to pronounce. When you hear about some sickness, you wonder what part of the body they affect and what damage they can do to someone’s health. Each of these sicknesses are not given the same kind of treatments as each of them are different but this morning I introduce the One who has One medicine to cure all sicknesses, Jesus sent forth His Word. Jesus did not have fancy, difficult names for sickness, he summed them up and called them the spirits of infirmities. There are sick Christians who believe they are sick because God is punishing them for something they did, God is not the author of sickness, He is the author of healing. The bible says, “He sent forth his word and healed ALL our diseases because He is the God who heals us” (paraphrased). The Almighty God still heals and heals all sicknesses, let no one talk you out of that.

The man who had been sick for 38 years waited every year for his healing. One day, when he least expected someone to visit him, Jesus shows up and asks him a simple question, “do you want to be made well?”. Why do we make things complicated when Jesus makes them simple? He’s question was simple but the man got into what was not done and should have been done. If you have tried everything and have failed, it can be hard to believe God in your situation. This man’s experience had hardened his heart to believe there was nothing different that could happen in his situation. That is why he was complicating things. With Jesus it’s not about what should have been done (past), it’s about now (His word sent forth). He can heal you now. He was in his situation 38 years and it took Jesus a second to heal him by sending His NOW word for the man to pick up his bed and walk. That is why I thank God because He is a God of now, He says in His word Joel 2:25 So I will restore to you the years that the swarming locust has eaten, The crawling locust, The consuming locust, And the chewing locust”. He is willing to restore, it’s already in His agenda. The healing did not begin when He showed up, it began the moment He was willing to restore you when He went on the cross, Mathew 8:17, “He Himself took our infirmities And bore our sicknesses.” . Sickness eats people’s health, He says He wants to restore your health what sickness has eaten (your health, strength, joy, peace, confidence, faith etc). Sicknesses are like the swarming, crawling, consuming and chewing locust, they devour the health not anymore because it’s Jesus’ word against the devours. When He asked the man, “do you want to be made well?”, the question was not necessarily to find out if the man needed healing, the question was to see if the man was ready for healing NOW. It’s about adjusting your faith to NOW as the restoration is now. Do you want to be made well?
Blessings Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Proverbs 18:10, “The name of the LORD is a strong tower; The righteous run to it and are safe”

Pastor Phil has invited me to teach on prayers at their church this Saturday, please do keep me in prayers. Also pray for this new couple David and Grace who desires to have a baby. Let’s not stop praying for this ministry especially for Pastor Phil and I. We are trusting God everyday to give us a fresh manna to feed us all. Let’s share today’s word

One winter evening, I had just driven to school through the heavy snow. Reaching school, I was informed my classes were canceled. Driving back from school going down the hill, my car decided to have a mind of it’s own. I lost control of the car, I tried breaks, emergency breaks, tried to steer back on the road but nothing was happening. I saw the car heading down the hill heading towards the trees that were down in the ditch. At that point, no other name I could remember to call on but the name of Jesus. Despite all the trees that were waiting for me, I did not hit any of them, the car went right between. Calling upon that name is what saved me.

There is something about that name. It bothers me when people use the name of the Lord loosely especially as a curse word. That name has power, it’s enough to get you out of a jam. You know of some powerful names out here but you can’t call on them when you are in trouble, they may not know you or have power to deliver and the most, they are limited to time and space, the Lord is different because He is ever present. The bible says, “the name of the Lord is a strong tower”, why a tower and not any other thing? Because a tower is a tall structure with the capability of standing alone. At the airports, towers are the control centers, all the communications about the landing and taking offs has to go through the towers, all signals through it, all routings are done through it. Incase of an emergency, the tower is notified. Without the tower, things would be in chaos. We thank the Lord because as a tower, everything goes through Him and we feel safe knowing we have called upon His name. From our devotion team, a lady emailed me to testify of how God saved her and her colleagues from a car accident over the weekend. The Lord was their strong tower that is why they were safe.

The Lord offers His name as a tower to call on when you and I are in trouble Psalm 50:15, “Call upon Me in the day of trouble; I will deliver you, and you shall glorify Me”, Psalm 91:15, “He shall call upon Me, and I will answer him; I will be with him in trouble; I will deliver him and honor him”, Psalm 18:3, “3I will call upon the LORD, who is worthy to be praised;  So shall I be saved from my enemies”. Choose ye this day whose name you will call on when you are in trouble.
