content.rendered:
Good morning,

1Samuel 24:1-22, vs. 10 Look, this day your eyes have seen that the LORD delivered you today into my hand in the cave, and someone urged me to kill you. But my eye spared you”

From experience, I think the most difficult people to forgive are the people you looked up to and trusted. If you know someone’s character, being told about what they have done might lead you to say, “That’s not like them”. It’s easier to deal with the ones you already know their nature than the ones who do things out of their character. We put such a high standard for the people we look up to and when they don’t live up to our expectations, we get hurt.

David looked up to Saul as a role model, a man chosen and anointed by God. He had a godly son Jonathan who was David’s best friend. Even though it was known that the son of a king would be groomed to be the next king, Jonathan knew David would be the next king instead of him and he was still cool with it. Saul referred to David as a son, who even played for him and entertained him. Saul knowing that David would be the next king troubled him that he wanted David dead. So for many years David was on the run fleeing from Saul. At times Saul would repent, but right after that, he would plan again to kill him. What would you do when someone you valued, looked up to, respected, admired was out to assassinate every blessing in your life, lied on you, did mean things, disappointed you? The normal thought would be, “how about I give them a dose of their own medicine”.

David who was being pursued by Saul on this particular time in 1Samuel 23&24, Saul brought over 3,000 men to pursue David who had about 600 men. When Saul and his men were exhausted from looking for David, they sat down to rest and they all fell a sleep. David and his men found them a sleep and his men encouraged him to kill his adversary. Remember God delivered Saul into David’s hands. What would you do? The power is in your hands, you feel it’s right to retaliate?. David might have also thought that revenge was justified but he chose not to. Later after he spared Saul and cut a piece of his robe, he says 1Samuel 24:1-22, vs. 10 Look, this day your eyes have seen that the LORD delivered you today into my hand in the cave, and someone urged me to kill you. But my eye spared you”. I believe God delivers people who have hurt and disappointed us into our hands and we have a choice to either revenge or give up the right to punish them. Had David killed Saul, I believe he would have messed up his future as the next king. Instead, he chose to forgive him by sparing his life and leaving him up to God. Un forgiveness tends to take power over the one who is holding onto it and God sets us up to situations where the power is in our hands and the choice is ours. Joseph had the power in his hands when God delivered his brothers into his hands and the choice was his. God delivered Jacob into Esau’s hands when He told him to go back, and Esau had the power in his hands to choose and he chose forgiveness. God sent His son into the world full of people who had failed God, who even the devil felt they did not deserve forgiveness. Jesus had the power to destroy all that failed Him, but He also had power to forgive. In short, the power to forgive or not to forgive is in our hands, God may deliver people who have hurt us deeply into our hands and how we handle them has everything to do with where we are going, the question is, can we give up our rights by forgiving and sparing them?. David didn’t have to punish Saul, God did; he didn’t have to kill to be the next king, God knew of the time. Romans 12:19, “Beloved, do not avenge yourselves, but rather give place to wrath; for it is written, “Vengeance is Mine, I will repay,”

Blessings Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“Then he said to them all: “If anyone would come after me, he must deny himself and take up his cross daily and follow me. (Luke 9:23)

What do you think of when you see the cross presented in this day and age?  The cross is found on our Bible covers, in our cemeteries, on our earrings, in our churches, perhaps in our homes, and of course around our necks.  Despite the fact that the cross is on display as something ornate, it seems that the cross has lost its potency among the world, and even among Christians I dare say.  The cross was a means of execution, equivalent to our electric chair, or lethal injection.  However can you imagine if all the places that you have a cross were replaced by an electric chair?    The electric chair doesn’t seem fitting to hang from our walls or our necks does it?

Jesus said that the cross had a fitting place in society and the place chosen by Christ was not as a Bible cover, a piece of Jewelry, or on a cemetery headstone, but rather in our lives.  It seems that there are many professing Christians today, but still few disciples.  If this is true then is it any different then in Jesus’ day?  Christ called for disciples not “decisions” in following Him.  The call goes out, but the disciples answer is not a spoken proclamation of faith, a decision at an altar.”  Instead, it is an obedient deed to faithfully carry one’s cross and walk behind Jesus.  Consider the following account:  “And as they led him away, they laid hold upon one Simon, a Cyrenian, coming out of the country, and on him they laid the cross, that he might bear it after Jesus.”  Jesus was too weak at this point to carry His own cross, and Simon was chosen to carry His cross and his cross.  Did you catch that?  The cross that Simon carried belonged at that moment both to Christ and to Simon, as it was Simon’s responsibility to BEAR IT AFTER JESUS.”  As you are reading this, would you have wanted that job?  No way!  Yet Christ calls you to deny yourself, take up you cross DAILY, and follow Him.  The late Dietrich Bonhoeffer said, “When Christ calls a man, He bid Him come and die.”  There is nothing comfortable about carrying a cross daily, yet that was, and is the call of Christ. 

What does it mean to carry your cross?  The first step to carrying your cross is to deny yourself. 
As a Christian you are not to set your desires and will against the right that Christ has to your life, because He has bought you with a price (1 Cor. 6:20).  You must have an ongoing realization that you now live for the sake of Christ, not for your own sake. Secondly, to carry your cross daily is to put down those things which crowd out the cross.  John said, “He must increase, and I must decrease.”  We must lay down our lives, and embrace our cross.  “A condemned criminal was forced to carry one bar of his cross to the place of execution. He was “on a one-way journey. He d not be back” (Morris, Luke, p. 170).” To take up the cross daily is to live each day, not for self, but for Christ.  Is this your testimony?  And thirdly we are to follow Him.  We are to burn our bridges to the world.  The children of Israel after coming out of Egypt (a type of the world), through the Red Sea, had a desire to go back to Egypt.  In the New Testament Jesus “No man, having put his hand to the plough, and looking back, is fit for the kingdom of God.”  If you are looking back at the world you left, how can you be simultaneously following Christ?  You can’t multi-task Christ’s call to deny yourself, take up your cross daily and follow Him.  Can you hear His call, or better yet, are your heeding His call? 

Application:  Christ’s call to deny yourself, take up your cross daily, is a distinguishing mark of a disciple.  Does that mark bear witness in your life?  Think about it.
Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: The Price of Serving God – Part 4, By Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“Or suppose a king is about to go to war against another king. Will he not first sit down and consider whether he is able with ten thousand men to oppose the one coming against him with twenty thousand? 32 If he is not able, he will send a delegation while the other is still a long way off and will ask for terms of peace. 33 In the same way, any of you who does not give up everything he has cannot be my disciple.” Luke 14:31-33

Many of us have heard the old adage, “choose your battles carefully.”  Why, because no one likes to loose a battle.  However battles are microcosm in the war which is the macrocosm.  In the vernacular a war is all the smaller battles combined that decide the outcome for the war victor. When an army is about to go to war the leader, in this case the king, must sit down and decide if he has the leadership to lead his men onto victory or defeat.  There is a lot at stake in a war such as losing lives, losing or gaining land, and of course power.  With war it has been said, “to the victor goes the spoils,” to what then is the consequence for the loser? 

Jesus said that when one goes off to war, he must come to a resolve if he chooses to indulge in the war that he will fight to the finish.  Why is one going to fight to the finish?  Real warriors fight to win, and will not fight “not to loose.”  To the determined in a war, there is no second place, only defeat.  Can a king with ten thousand soldier’s defeat a king with twenty thousand is the question to contemplate? If one were to answer this question based on quantity of soldiers the answer would lean very much toward a NO!  However, if one were to answer this question based on quality of them the answer may go either way depending upon the quality of the opposing armies.

Why has Jesus likened a war scenario to being his disciple?  Think of war, there are great victories, and also casualties.  As a Christian the commitment that you make to your commander (Christ) and to the body of Christ (your fellow soldiers) should not be a flippant decision.  The decision to follow Christ is a hard reality, because Jesus wants followers not “fans,” he is calling for disciples, those who would ultimately die for Him if they needed to.  Does this describe you, or are you just along for “the ride?”  Living for Jesus is not a Sunday to Sunday thing, but a daily commitment, and one must wear the armor of God to fight in the spiritual war that Christians are engaged in (Eph. 6)

Lastly, Jesus speaks of giving up everything to be His disciple.  This is not necessarily saying that one need part with all earthly possessions and live a life of poverty.  Rather a disciple is one that has yielded up all of his right because they have been bought with a price (1 Cor. 6:20) and therefore all possessions have changed ownership and now belong to the Lord.  Disciples are merely caretakers, or stewards of the possessions.  Disciples live a life wit the mentality of abandonment of things and their lives upon their trust in Christ.  The rich young ruler (Mk. 10, Lk. 18), although desiring eternal life, refused to part with those things, the riches, that Christ called him to part with.  He would not submit to Christ as Lord, and choose the treasures of this world rather then heavenly treasure, and therefore choose to be a disciple of the world rather then a disciple of Christ. There is a price to serve God, and Christ paid by His blood to purchase you from the enemy.

Application:  Where do you stand today?  Do you feel the battles, in the midst of the war?  Have you truly contemplated your decision to follow Him in abandonment?  Are you living as a disciple of Christ or of one of this world?  Are you willing to pay the price to serve Him?

Blessings
Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Proverbs 22:6, “Train up a child in the way he should go, And when he is old he will not depart from it”

There are some of those scriptures that leave you scratching your head, to me the above is one of them. I came from a Christian home, my parents started training me on Christian values at a very young age. At the age of four my dad would bring me to missions with him even sing together. One of the greatest things my parents did to pave ways in this life was pray was to pray their siblings. Not only did they pray for the current things at that age, they prayed for our future lives (our ministries, our mates, our children, our jobs etc). This shows me that it’s never too early to pray for the future of your kids.

In my teenage years, I hated going to church, did not want anything to do with God, I went to church for the sake of going to church. Now that I think about my early teenage years I wonder how the above scripture applies. I was trained in the way I should go but what happened?, I backed away from it. How would you apply the last part “And when he is old he will not depart from it”? How many children have been brought up in Christian homes and later became the worse kids, some got into drugs, rebellious, ran away from home you name it. The only way I can understand this scripture is this, whatever you teach the child when he/she is growing up will not depart from him/her. The values I was taught, the prayers invested, the encouragement, the love and care would not depart from me even though I went my way. The prodigal son could run away from home, but he could never run away from what he was taught as a child. At one point in my life I just got tired of living outside Christ and God changed me inside out. During the time I was away from the Lord, my mom and dad kept on praying for me, loving me, caring for me until I was restored and forever I am grateful to God for them.

From my experience, I think there are three important things that can help raise children, one and the most important is prayer, being able to lift them up before God and let God give you guidance, wisdom, and care for your children. Setting a strong foundation in Christ and paving a way for their future lives as young kids, teenagers, young adults, adults. Letting God help you raise up your kids. Hannah prayed for her son Samuel and then gave him to God to help her raise him. The other important thing is instructing them about the things of life, teaching them right and wrong, educating them. This enables them to make right judgments and choices in their lives as you now commend them to God. And the other which is as equally important is living an example. I would say that I have learnt more from my parents by observing how they live their life as Christians, as husband and wife, as parents, as workers and as citizens more than any teaching they could give me. Their life style has set up a standard to desire what they have. This has even helped me pick out my companion, taught me hard work, taught me that prayer changes things, taught me patience, taught me how to survive hardships. Their life style has taught me what hundreds of books would never teach. Children learn a lot by observing, so parents ought to live a life they would want their kids to live. Have a marriage based on L.O.V.E (L for Listening, O for openness, V for Value and E for Everlasting) if you want your children to have the same one day (producing after your kind). Do good, be hard workers, they will pick on that and live your life pleasing to the Lord. I go back to see where I have come from, see the things that I learnt, they are fresh in my mind and I am by the help of God putting them into practice, now I know what I was taught could never depart from me. My prayer is to produce after their kind in my family one day.
Blessings
Evans

content.rendered:
The other day i was chatting with a dear friend of mine. We were talking about every Christians role as an evangelist. And in our discussion i got to hear an amazing perspective from her. What she said blew my shoes off. I sensed it was the Holy spirit speaking through her… This may change your perspective too…!

“Times they are a’ changing… Its for a certain fact that every other decade witnesses some major change in the society, in its lifestyle / mannerisms / perspective / practises. Just about everything you’ve known or heard would have changed a decade or two later. Be it your plans or destiny, both would have undergone change. Our God is trendy! He completely understands us! And just see how we understood HIM…
-In the recent times of fast paced gadgets and effective communication, Christ isn’t unknown to anyone. If not seen or heard about Jesus, people would surely have known Him as one of the many religious figures.
-Every one talks about Jesus .. He is latest swear word now, you see! Don’t be surprised if someone tells you, “If you haven’t taken his name in vain, than you ain’t happening!” … that is the fate of The NAME that is above all names! That is the worldly status of the NAME, that when taken, can shake up mountains/ nations tremble / drive away demons …
-There are movies on Jesus that are made popular … They are critically acclaimed for the powerful portrayal of the characters (what did you expect… its the role of God in human form)
-They are made popular for all the wrong reasons… the media accuses them of being too bloody… and demands an absolute (A) rating… discouraging the entire family from watching it … and then you have a decent looking house wife who’s made to show up on TV on the Public verdict channel, giving her critical comment, “why do they make such pictures, which scared the @#*$ out of me… ohh Lord… i just couldn’t bear to see… it is not correct to make money out of exaggerated religious stories… just not right…they should ban such movies” .. Little does she know that the same blood was shed for her for her sins to be washed away!
-The Bible- Someone already categorised it as the most controversial book ever, over centuries..! If you haven’t read it and don’t have a point or two to dispute or criticize, than you may not be included in the popular cult group in your college or could be considered an illiterate or a scum bag villager…!
-Novels written on baseless truths are much trusted and spoken about than compared to the LIVING WORD OF GOD…
-Every Church in town has the WORD pasted all over its walls, in blown up formats, for everyone to see. That is the living WORD, out in the open for the whole world to witness… Passionate Christians even have the rear of their vehicles painted with some catchy / encouraging scriptures … the whole world knows NOW, that … JESUS SAVES …. JESUS HEALS  … JESUS LOVES … THE LORD IS MY SHEPHERD …JESUS IS THE WAY!
-There’s street side stalls that sell crosses with the crucified figures of Christ along with Skulls & crossbones and ugly looking beasts and even porn figures… what a mix-up… I know a friend who accepted Christ, when she saw a painting of the cross, hands stretched an dead, with the words I loved you so much! I wonder how she’d have felt if she saw HIM at the street vendors stall!

to be continued…
Please donot fail to read the continuation …

content.rendered:
Good morning,

2Ti 1:5 I have been reminded of your sincere faith, which first lived in your grandmother Lois and in your mother Eunice and, I am persuaded, now lives in you also.

Happy Mother’s day to all moms reading this devotion, please pass it on to others. 

Many times the manner of life that has been lived or is being lived out by a person can be traced back to the parents.  What did one’s parent teach them, and pass on to them to pass on to their family and to the world?  What is passed on is the making of a legacy weather good or bad.

The dictionary defines a legacy as [Something handed down from an ancestor or a predecessor or from the past: a heritage of moral uprightness; a rich inheritance of storytelling; a legacy of philosophical thought; the tradition of noblesse oblige].

When one thinks of mothers of the Bible who comes to mind?  Perhaps names like Eve, Hannah, Hagar, Bathsheba, Elizabeth, and of course Mary.  Does the name Eunice come to mind? Her name probably wouldn’t come to mind.  However, the Apostle Paul thought her of such great importance that he mentioned her in his second and final letter to Timothy even though briefly.  Not only did Paul mention Eunice, but also Lois Eunice’s mom.  Paul is showing Timothy that it was not only Paul’s discipling of Timothy that was responsible for his spiritual maturity to serve as a pastor, but first and foremost it was the legacy of faith passed on from Lois to Eunice and now to Timothy before Paul was even in Timothy’s life.  Lois can beam with pride that she passed her faith off to her daughter Eunice.  Eunice can smile greatly as she has passed faith off to her son Timothy who was discipled by Paul and served as a pastor.   

Mother’s can pass off a legacy through the godly living and nurturing of their children.  As a mother what kind of legacy has you passed on or are passing on now?  Can your daughter look at you and respect how you have shown to love her dad?  Can she treat her husband the way you treated yours, and so please Christ?  There are those moms that have a testimony like Lois and Eunice and for them we should praise God!   You want your children to grow up and be committed to Christ and serve Him wholeheartedly.  As a parent, you don’t want to suffer the heartache of our child rebelling against their Christian upbringing.  However, “Eighty-eight percent of children raised in evangelical homes leave church at the age of eighteen never to return.”  This is tragic.  “The kind of legacy you leave will be seen in the kind of life you lead.”  

In no way am I suggesting that the father does not have an equally vital role, he should do his part absolutely.  However, statistically it is the women that are leading that charge in spiritual matters.  Check out the link   http://www.barna.org/FlexPage.aspx?Page=BarnaUpdate&BarnaUpdateID=47

Now go and pass on a godly legacy.  Here are some helpful mother’s resources.  
If you are a mother with young children may I suggest the book How to Bring Your Children to Christ & Keep Them There by Ray Comfort .  http://www.livingwaters.com/Merchant2/merchant.mv?Screen=PROD&Product_Code=140

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Hebrews 10:9, “Then said he, lo I come to do thy will, O  God, He taketh away the first, that He may establish the SECOND.”

The above has been the theme verse for my life for many years, it changed my life completely. God amazes me in ways I would never imagine or think. Every time He messes my theology and I come to a place of surrender again. He is always doing something in our lives so that our confidence is not in ourselves or our ability but on Him alone.

Why the does God love to raise the SECOND and not the first? What’s the second anyway?, Well God bypassed Cain the first born and blessed Abel the second. We see this again with Esau and Jacob, God blessed Jacob the second. With Manasseh and Ephraim, the blessing bypassed Manasseh and landed on Ephraim the second. Perez and Zerah had the same struggle at the time of delivery. Zerah was suppose to come out first and Perez overtook him. And the best of all these, Adam and Jesus. Adam was the son of God, Jesus (the second Adam) was (is) the ONLY begotten Son of God. Why is this so important? Because God always raises the unexpected. He always raises the least likely. This is not to show that God never blesses or raises the first born, this is to tell us that God has no favorites. Remember the first born always received the blessing and God is showing us that it’s not always going to be the one everyone is expecting to be blessed and used. You might have looked at someone you thought could be of more use in the ministry than you, don’t be surprised when He raises you in levels you could never imagine or think. You thought of yourself second, watch out.

If you and I are going to be raised and used by God, we are going to bypass everything that we thought He could use in our lives and look at things we placed second (secondary). I am not dismissing the fact that He can take the gift He has placed in you and use it, I’m saying He can take that which you overlooked, the simple and silly to you. That which to you had no significance, He can make something great out of it. It’s not by ability that God raises people, it is by availability that he raises people. If you were waiting till you are able to be used, then you’ve missed the whole purpose of Him raising the second. Look at how Hebrews 10:9 begins, “Then said he, lo I come to do thy will, O God”. This does not suggest ability but availability (coming).  “He taketh away the first, that He may establish the SECOND”, God is establishing which is to say He is bringing about the overlooked as He has something for the second. The second has a way of making us humble, reminding us that it’s about Him and not us. This is where our faith is elevated when you think of how God could take nothing and make something out of it. What have you put aside as second? Are you waiting till you are able to say Lord I have come to do thy will? Romans 8:30, “30 Moreover whom He predestined, these He also called; whom He called, these He also justified; and whom He justified, these He also glorified. Rise up, be available to be used of Him, that is what He requires.
Blessings Ev

title.rendered: The Redeemed Of The Lord Shall Return

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Isaiah 35:9, “…But only the redeemed will walk there, 10 and the ransomed of the LORD will return.

A story is told of a boy who had in his hands sickly, weak birds. He was playing with them in a way that suggested they would not live long. As he continued to play with them, an old wise man came to the little boy and asked if he could buy those birds to him. Looking at the condition of those weak, sick birds, the boy could not understand why a grown old, wise man was interested in paying so much for those birds leave alone taking them for free. That is when the boy understood that to him those birds were worthless but to the old man, those birds were of value to him.

At times I sit and wonder whether I fully understand the love of God in my life. “His love is better than life?” is mind blowing and hard to comprehend. I tend to think at times that God loves me more based on how I live for Him. The days I mess us, I feel like He is going to send a calamity or something and I even wait for it. And the devil uses this to put me down. He may even accuse me of messing up and that might be true but God’s love is not based on who we are and what we have done. His love is based on what He did when He demonstrated His love on the cross through His Son. With this said, there is nothing we can do to make God loves us more, and there is nothing we can do to make Him love us less. His love is unconditional, has no strings attached and no boundaries, He is not prejudice and has no favorites. He loves us in spite of who we are. You may feel like God does not love you because of your background, the devil is a liar. God is love, He is the definition of love.

To understand His love for me, I first need to understand the word redeem. It gives the precedent of what love is to me. Redeem is to recover ownership by paying a specified sum. Can I say I was worth redeeming? I was just like the little sick, weak birds with no value. That is how I felt, worthless. People tend to want to redeem something that is of value, what if it’s of no value? Isaiah 63:9. “In His love and in His pity He redeemed them(us)”. What did God see in us to redeem us? He must love us so much that regardless of who we were and thought of ourselves, He still loved us with an everlasting love and with that love, He stooped down to redeem us back. Job was sick and weak, his life was meaningless but he never forgot to remember that despite of who he was, God still loved him unconditionally and that is why he was confident to say Job 19:25, “For I know that my Redeemer lives, And He shall stand at last on the earth;”.

Because He has redeemed us, bought us by the blood of the Lamb, we can’t keep on putting ourselves down. Read Isaiah 35 and see how the redeemed appear, vs. 1 wilderness and dessert shall be glad for them, vs. 2. they shall blossom abundantly and rejoice, vs. 2. they shall see the glory of the Lord, vs. 3 they shall strengthen the weak, vs. 4, they shall encourage etc. God has set a highway that only the redeemed shall walk on. You can only return as the redeemed when you know how He loves you. Isaiah 35:10, “And the ransomed of the LORD shall return, And come to Zion with singing, With everlasting joy on their heads. They shall obtain joy and gladness, And sorrow and sighing shall flee away. If you’ve been down feeling worthless, feeling like you’ve messed big time and feeling like God loves you less, I am here to challenge us, the redeem of the Lord shall return, it’s time to return to the Lord as the redeemed. Live, speak, walk, stand like the redeemed. Psalm 107:2, Let the redeemed of the LORD say so,  Whom He has redeemed from the hand of the enemy, Blessing Ev

title.rendered: The Price of Serving God – Part 3, By Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“Suppose one of you wants to build a tower. Will he not first sit down and estimate the cost to see if he has enough money to complete it? For if he lays the foundation and is not able to finish it, everyone who sees it will ridicule him, saying, ‘This fellow began to build and was not able to finish.’” Luke 14:28-30

Have you ever built a house before?  I can honestly say that the closest I’ve ever come to building a house, is when I built a club house as a child, and it didn’t hold up too well.  You see I had an immature boys understanding of building, based on fun, not commitment.  I was thinking of a place to play and have “a secret hide out,” and not, if the club house would last for 5, 10, 20, 30 years.  Why, because I wasn’t challenged as a boy to count the cost of my building.  The cost I paid was a little time, using free fallen trees, branches, and leaves, but there was no sacrifice involved.  Even though I don’t believe I will ever have the necessary skills and knowledge to build a real house for my family, I desire to live in one that is built well, by an expert builder. 

Jesus focuses on the vital elements for building a tower.  He share that first the builder needs to sit down and contemplate about his plan so as not to make a rash decision.  Jesus asked the question, ‘Will he [the builder] not first sit down and estimate the cost to see if he has enough money to complete it?  If one does not have the sufficient funds to finish the project it is because the decision to build was not entirely thought through.  One may want to build, but one doesn’t always get nor do what they want.  This is a major life decision at stake.  Christ depicts our lives like a building in Matthew 7 speaking about the wise and the foolish builder.  When the tragedies of life come will our lives be able to weather the storms that come?  The Psalmist said it this way, “Unless the LORD builds the house, its builders labor in vain.”  Our lives should not be built on fame, fortune, others, etc…, but on Christ alone. 

Jesus also points to the on-lookers.  People will look as those building their buildings and if they are not able to finish, the on-lookers will ridicule the builders.  If a builder talks the talk of building this great structure and all that is seen by others is the foundation, then what will be said of that builder?  The world is watching us as the church, and seeing if we as the church are really committed to the cause of Christ.  If I really give God my all, what will my family, friends, co-workers, and even Christian friends think of me?  Yes the cost of following Christ needs to be considered.  In John 6:66, Jesus challenged all who were following Him, and the Scripture states, “From this time many of his disciples turned back and no longer followed Him.”  How sad to start the building, hence following Christ, but to cease the work.  Paul tells us “Let us not become weary in doing good, for at the proper time we will reap a harvest if we do not give up.” Jesus twelve had to count that cost after seeing Christ crucified.  They each had to contemplate, “do I want to follow this Jesus, and after all if they killed him what will they do to me?”  There are some attending churches that are religious phonies, but what do others see when they look at your house, your life? 

Application:  May your desire resonate with Paul’s words when he said, “I consider my life worth nothing to me, if only I may finish the race and complete the task the Lord Jesus has given me-the task of testifying to the gospel of God’s grace.” Count the cost…pay the price, it’s worth it. By Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

John 3:30, “He must increase, but I must decrease”

Representing Christ is an exciting thing. Life outside Christ is not just hard but impossible. As a song goes, “We want to see Jesus lifted high a banner that flies across the land, that men might see that Jesus is the way to heaven”. It is a beautiful thing to represent Christ. To be His ambassador in this world. Christ MUST be exalted which to say, we must raise His rank, glorify, praise, worship and honor Him. That is the number one duty of man. It’s not about position, ministry or calling that is on top.

I am fascinated by the life of John the Baptist, he is about 6 months older than Jesus in human form. He was sent to be a way maker for Jesus. John understood the concept of the older serving the younger. John baptized with water unto repentance, Jesus baptized with the Holy Ghost and fire. John did ministry way before Jesus began and some even thought he was the promised Christ. He kept on mentioning to them that he wasn’t neither was he a prophet. He was a just a voice crying out in the wilderness preparing the way for  the Lord. John was an ambassador preparing people to meet Christ, the Lamb of God that takes away the sins of the world. John was respected and people responded to his teachings, he kept on speaking of the One to come hence decreasing that the One who had not been reveled yet would increase. John 1:26, “I baptize with water, but there stands One among you whom you do not know. 27 It is He who, coming after me, is preferred before me, whose sandal strap I am not worthy to loose.” John had everything thing and everyone to elevate him but never once did he take the glory. He understood that everything that was happening in his life and his ministry was about Christ. Therefore everything that he did, he made sure that Christ outshine him. John lost two of his disciples to Jesus in John 1:37 and his thought, Christ must increase. People were getting concerned because Jesus was getting more fame, people followed Christ more than John but listen to John speaking John 3:29, “He who has the bride is the bridegroom; but the friend of the bridegroom, who stands and hears him, rejoices greatly because of the bridegroom’s voice. Therefore this joy of mine is fulfilled.  John’s fulfillment came about knowing that he had exalted Christ. He understood his job perfectly.

How does this apply to us as believers, number one to understand it’s not about us but Him. Our job is to exalt Christ every where we go. In the job how we act and behave will show whether Christ is increasing or decreasing. It will also show whether people see more of us or they see Christ more. The Spirit must arise that the flesh be removed. Our attitude towards people, His blessings, our callings and ministries will indicate whether we are decreasing and He is increasing or the other way round. See people were getting concerned that John was loosing his position and his response was John 3:30, He MUST increase” not He should increase or may increase but MUST. He made sure the “MUST” was in effect. John did not wait for Christ to overtake him by staying constant, he made sure he took more out of his life (decreased) for the sake of Christ. John could only bow because he was humbled, can we do the same?  Saying Lord is about You and not us, more of You and less of us, Whole of You and none of us, You MUST increase but I must decrease. I will do everything that I can to make sure He increases. The bible says in 1Peter 5:6,”Therefore humble yourselves under the mighty hand of God, that He may exalt you in due time” , did Christ exalt John in due season? Matthew 11:10-11 For this is he of whom it is written: “Behold, I send My messenger before Your face, Who will prepare Your way before You.”  11″Assuredly, I say to you, among those born of women there has not risen one greater than John the Baptist. I want to humble myself that He may increase in my life while I decrease, I MUST exalt Him whatever the cost. Blessings Evans

title.rendered: The Price of Serving God – Part 2, By Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

 “If anyone comes to me and does not hate…yes, even his own life-he cannot be my disciple. And anyone who does not carry his cross and follow me cannot be my disciple.”
Luke 14:26-27

Jesus called those that would be His disciples to not only put Him before all family, but even to place Him before ourselves.  He says that we are to hate even our own lives as compared to our love for Him.  John writes, “And they overcame him by the blood of the Lamb, and by the word of their testimony; and they loved not their lives unto the death.”  Jesus wants followers that are living for something worth dying for and He is worthy of making such a request of us, as he died for us while we were yet sinners Romans 5:8 tells us.  Examine the following list as history reveals the fate of the apostles:

PHILIP: Stoned to death, Phrygia, A.D. 54
BARNABAS: Burned to death, Cyprus, A.D. 64
PETER: Crucified, Rome, A.D. 69
PAUL: Beheaded, Rome, A.D. 69
ANDREW: Crucified, Achaia, A.D. 70
MATTHEW: Beheaded, Ethiopia, A.D. 70
LUKE: Hanged, Greece, A.D. 93
THOMAS: Speared to death, Calamino, A.D. 70
MARK: Dragged to death, Alexandria, A.D. 64
JAMES (THE LESS): Clubbed to death, Jerusalem, A.D. 63
JOHN: Abandoned, Isle of Patmos, A.D. 63

Now I am not advocating that we go out and try to be a martyr for Christ, because that is not the goal.  The goal however is as John said, He must become greater; I must become less.”  Let’s examine three areas of our lives and see who we love more, Jesus or ourselves.  I call this the three T’s.  I believe that the disciples had these areas submitted to His Lordship, but do you?

Time – each one has 168 hours a week to spend however we would like.  Both you and President Bush have the same amount of time.  How do you spend your time?  Does your time glorify you more or the Lord more?  A good self check is to take the Time Management Inventory (see attachment).  I suggest this for a weekend project, it is a valuable resource.  Is Jesus really the Lord of the way that you spend your time?

2. Talents – What spiritual gifts and natural abilities do you have?  Again do you use them to serve your kingdom or to advance the Kingdom of God?  Everyone has at least one spiritual gift and natural ability, although most have multiple. 

3. Treasure – How do you spend your money?  Do you consider it your money or the Lord’s?  Do you realize that you are a steward, a caretaker of what belongs to Him?  Do you tithe and give offerings.  What do you spend your money on?  Do your checkbook and credit card statements reflect your will or His will?

Application:  we can examine other areas, but if He is your Lord, it will be reflected in these three areas of your life.  If you HAD TO, die for Him could you?  Examine yourself in these three practical areas, and make the necessary changes and submit to Him as Lord.  Meditate on Matt 25, 2 Cor. 5:17 and Gal 2:20.  Blessings to you! Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Isaiah 37:3, “And they said to him, “Thus says Hezekiah:, “This is a day of trouble and rebuke and blasphemy; for the children have come to birth, but there is no strength to bring them forth”

Good things are happening in this evil world we are living in. Souls are getting saved, ministries are being started, women’s groups, young adults, youth, children, nursery, benevolence, evangelism to mention a few. These groups have different goals and one of them is brings people together. Christians ought to be plugged in somewhere where they can be fed, ministered to and also be used to serve. It’s good to come to receive but there reaches a point where the receiving time ceases and giving times begin, a time to maximize the gifting inside of you. The bible says that, “It’s blessed to give than receive” and I happen to have proven this, as you give, you are not running dry, you are gaining more. I get more blessed and encouraged when I am giving encouragements to someone else. The more I encourage, the more I get encouraged.

You will agree with me that there are many good things happening and yet there is less strength to accomplish them. New responsibilities, new ministries, new positions, new converts, new seeds that need to be planted and yet many have no strength to bring them forth. People are scared of moving for they feel they will mess up things, they feel like they are not able and the like. You can testify of the gift’s God has given you but there is no strength to fully utilize them. How about desires and dreams and yet when you look at your current situation and the things that are standing on the way, you just can’t see how in the world you can deliver what has been invested in you. If it was not invested, I would not think much about it. But I am talking about something that is tangible, something you can see the signs, something that you know you have but bringing it out becomes the problem and now you are stuck with a baby inside of you for you have no strength to deliver.

Believe me, many are going to end this life still carrying inside what they should have brought forth. King Hezekiah was threatened by king of Assyria, they even went a head to say that even God would not deliver Hezekiah and therefore he shouldn’t trust in Him. King Hezekiah had something inside of him and that is the trust that God was able and would deliver him and his people but I don’t think that there were so many people in his kingdom who had that kind of faith. Not only did he believe, he also confessed it and acted on his confession. There he went to the temple with some of the elders and priests. He also sent a message to Isaiah the prophet. This was the message to Isaiah,  Isaiah 37:3, “And they said to him, “Thus says Hezekiah:, “This is a day of trouble and rebuke and blasphemy;” I paused for a second and wondered why it was a day of trouble and I began to see that the people believed inside it could happen but there was no evidence on the outside to show that they were ready for what the Lord was going to do. It’s good to know it inside, but what is inside has to be practiced outside. You can believe that God is able but until you engage your faith into action and confess it, it will still be inside not accomplishing much. Romans 10:10, “For with the heart man believes unto righteousness, and with the mouth confession is made unto salvation”. It’s by the confession that you birth salvation. The woman with the issue of blood believed inside, that is what kept her pregnant and when she began to confess, she began to push out what was inside of her, faith.

Isaiah 37:3, “…for the children have come to birth, but there is no strength to bring them forth”.  God has deposited things in us, they are ready but the question is, are we ready? The gifts are at the peak of being birthed, the ministries are yet to be birthed but are you ready? there are preachers, prayer warriors, teachers, prophets and prophetess, pastors in our midst. Are you feeling like there is something in you that the Lord could birth but you have no strength, (enough faith to believe it can happen?). Are you still holding onto something that should have been birthed by now? I know that I’m pregnant with some things but have I have less strength to birth them. I have seen the signs, I know they are there and I can’t keep on holding them inside for they are due for birth. Help me Lord, I have new responsibilities I need to birth, moving to greater levels I need to birth, zeal to win souls I need to birth. It’s tough and scary and painful but I can’t die holding onto this thing inside of me. Lord give me more faith to strengthen me to birth what is inside. The church, ministries, job, family needs you even more but you have to bring forth what is inside of you and utilize it. Bring Forth What Is Inside!!!! Blessing Evans

“Our God is a Jealous God” … try sharing this with someone who doesn’t believe in Jesus… Keeping aside the possibility of him accepting Jesus, he’ll give you a piece of his mind… because those who belong to the world, donot understand our GOD… they cannot even relate to HIM … HIS ways are not theirs and their ways are not HIS…
The TRUTH is that, as the bible says, our God is a JEALOUS God… He dislikes to share HIS glory with anyone else… anyone at all …
-And moreover He has every reason to be angry each time we try and take credit for stuff that HE does through us…  remember – all good things come from HIM right … no exceptions whatsoever … If you were thinking you were the mastermind behind that wonderful thing that you did… i suggest you think again!
-God watches in astonishment, even as we take all the glory that belongs to HIM … remember all those instances when you were lifted high to the skies when someone came to you and said, “bro’ thank you for all your prayers” … and you were on cloud nine … when someone says, “bro’ your words were very encouraging / your deeds were so touching …. i think you are the Lord’s angel, specially appointed for me”…how you relished every word and kept meditating on it…!
Donot confuse this with the Joy that we go through when someone shares their victory in Christ… The JOY of the Lord’s name being glorified is outstanding! Inexplicable.. out of the world! But is that what it is, all the TIME?

The question here is, “how would you feel, if you have been praying really hard for someone, and the person knows that too… and then one fine day the prayer gets answered in a wonderful way … do you expect the person to come to you and appreciate/acknowledge/commend your faith ?… do you expect the person, to thank you and display gratitude ? … would you feel offended if the person doesn’t even mention that the prayer has been answered, to you..?  How would you feel …?

Let me speak about something that is more elementary …
-do you feel offended when you not asked to pray in your Church gathering, specially when you are the eldest amongst them all…?
-do you feel offended when your efforts are not recognised …?
-do you feel upset when you aren’t treated the way you expected to be treated …?
-do you feel discouraged when people donot appreciate your work …?
-do you feel embarrassed and take it real personal, when you are humiliated in private or public ..?

a few of you might even be wondering what has all this got to do with PRIDE … well i’ll tell you what…!!!
all of us tolerate some amount of pride in our systems… no denial … we all do … the SELF- our flesh and blood always tries to push itself up… it wants recognition! it longs for appreciation!. it would kill for a celebrity status! if not atleast a status where you are looked upto.! and if a little wisdom were to also add to it … the self also tries and plays HUMBLE … false humility as it is called…

not happening mate..! Lucifer had PRIDE, way back then and attempted to take the GLORY from GOD… today we know his fate…. we know what is in store for HIM, don’t we..!

task :  let us remember that
-Jesus is our LORD and saviour
-He died so that we could live …
-The Lord of all became a servant and humbled HIMSELF to the least, in every manner…
-We are to remember that He was humiliated before US …
AND IT IS NO LONGER YOU, BUT CHRIST THAT LIVES IN YOU…..!

title.rendered: The Price of Serving God, by Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

The late John F. Kennedy said, “And so my fellow Americans, ask not what your country can do for you; ask what you can do for your country.”  I believe spiritually speaking that many people treat God as a big cosmic Santa Clause that they feel should be blessing their lives and keeping them out of harms way and tragedies reach.  So the question is raised, what are you willing to do for God?  Whatever your answer might be, serving God comes with a price.  When some of you made an outward profession of your faith, you may have lost friends, been distanced by family, and seemed to have gained some new enemies.  The cost of serving God is real, but many don’t consider the price tag in their decision. 

In Luke 14, Jesus speaks of the price of serving him by using four illustrations which are:  family, self,  building/labor, and war.  To show the emphasis on the price of serving he starts with the family structure by saying, “If any man come to me, and hate not his father, and mother, and wife, and children, and brethren, and sisters, yea, and his own life also, he cannot be my disciple.”  WOW, those are some hard words.  Jesus uses what we commonly call a hyperbole, which is statement of extremes, contrasting love with hate for emphasis’ sake. Jesus stresses that that as much as we treasure our spouse and family, and even our own life, there should be no one whom we love and value more than God, no one who takes precedence in our life. Jesus is to clearly be at the top of our love list, and the focal point of all our affections.  To place love for another or anything else, including ourselves, above God is idolatry.

When we heed the call to follow the Lord, we must leave behind certain things that would be a distraction to following Him.  For Peter and Andrew it was their nets that they left behind.  Likewise, when He called James and John they too left their nets, but also their boat and their father.  The rich young ruler that desired eternal life was asked to part with his riches, he could not bring himself to do it, and Jesus just moved on.  In Matthew 8:21-22 it states, “Another disciple said to him, “Lord, first let me go and bury my father.” But Jesus told him, “Follow me, and let the dead bury their own dead.”  Was Jesus unconcerned about the family businesses and family tragedies? No.  However He was more concerned about His will, and having steadfast followers.

Is Jesus telling us to downright forsake our families as a cost to follow Him?  More accurately Jesus is touching on whomever or whatever is in your life that serves as a distraction to serve him, hence serving Him comes with a price.  Let me illustrate in a practical way.  Perhaps your family desires your presence at an Easter diner, but your local church is doing an outreach to the community the same day and you can help.  What would be the real purpose for Easter, sharing about the risen Savior or eating with your family? My wife and I have had to make decisions as such.  Does this mean that we love our families any less, by no means?  However it does call for our lives to first and foremost commit to Him and His work, even before family at times.  If He is our Father, we must weigh out our commitments under His Lordship.  There is a price to serving the Lord, but it is certainly not without it benefits.    Recall the words of Peter saying to Christ, “We have left everything to follow you! What then will there be for us?” Jesus said to them, “I tell you the truth, at the renewal of all things, when the Son of Man sits on his glorious throne, you who have followed me will also sit on twelve thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.   And everyone who has left houses or brothers or sisters or father or mother or children or fields for my sake will receive a hundred times as much and will inherit eternal life.”   

Application:  What is God calling you to give up for the sake of following Him?  Remember the price may be great at the moment, but the blessings to follow are even greater. Blessings Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Psalm 53:1, “The fool has said in his heart, “There is no God.”

The notion of God has been debated over and over again. To my surprise, there are people who believed that God existed at one point but now He is not or if He is, He has abandoned His creation. Some believe the nature of man killed God. One man by the name of Friedrich Nietzsche is notable for having declared that God is dead and for having written several of his works in the presumption that man must find a new mode of being given the demise of God. To speak more on this, we have even people who walk as though God does not exist. Yes they may not verbally deny His existence, their actions reveals in their world He is dead.

One of the reasons I hear the most is the fact that people can’t see how God could create in six days, that He has no beginning and has no end, has no end. If He is God, then who created Him. If He is present , then why is there suffering in the world? One prophet tried to understand God and his head hurt because no one can ever fully understand God. His ways are not our ways, His thoughts are not our thoughts, as high as the heaven is from the earth…How the far is the heaven from earth? Can our small mind contain who God is?

God is a live and well, I spoke with Him this morning. I could feel His presence moving in the air and I know that He is ever present. The thought that God is no longer existing therefore man can run their lives in the way they feel is pleasing to them makes me wonder where the world is getting to. I see crosses with Jesus still hanging on them, maybe some still are still hanged on the belief that Jesus died on the cross and may still be dead. The fact that the cross is empty and the fact the tomb is empty is an indication that He is a live. Therefore I don’t have to see the tomb to know that He is a live, I just need to call on Him. If we were praying to a dead God that would be insane but because we know He is alive and hears our prayers, we have no reason to run our lives as though He is no longer present. Revelation 10:5 The angel whom I saw standing on the sea and on the land raised up his hand[a] to heaven 6 and swore by Him who lives forever and ever, who created heaven and the things that are in it, the earth and the things that are in it, and the sea and the things that are in it, that there should be delay no longer, 7but in the days of the sounding of the seventh angel, when he is about to sound, the mystery of God would be finished, as He declared to His servants the prophets. I wonder why the bible not only said He lives forever (eternity), it adds and “ever”, well he has no beginning and he has no end. Can we deal with that?

With the order of creation, by looking at everything that surrounds us, how can we not see God in them? I see God in people because they reflect what only God could reflect through them. It’s the fool who has closed his mind to block out what ought to reveal to him who God is. David says in Psalm 19:1 The heavens declare the glory of God; And the firmament shows His handiwork. 2Day unto day utters speech, And night unto night reveals knowledge. 3There is no speech nor language Where their voice is not heard. He has shown us that He is God and He has reached to us because we are His. He has drawn Himself closer that we may not treat Him as though He never existed. And He has provided unto us to show us we can never do it alone. Psalm 86:7, “In the day of my trouble I will call upon You, For You will answer me”, because He is a live, In God we trust. He will answer you when you call on Him.

Blessings Evans

content.rendered:
“pride goeth before fall”
-does this topic need any introduction at all… I doubt it!
-all of us grew up hearing this famous proverb… if not many, at least at one instance in our lives..!
-we all believe in it … all of us have understood it … a few of us even preached it to others…
-and there also are a few of us who’ve discovered the thin red line that separates ‘pride’ from being / feeling proud about something …!
-i think that is really very cool… its nice to be humble … lowly and down to earth … and we find it all the more nice when someone finds us “humble / down
to earth / lowly”
-none of us would purposefully put on display our prideful nature… do we?? … its to remain on the inside … ;-]  lol

But wait a second. God our Father, looks at our hearts.. doesn’t He?. He knows everything that goes on the inside. Is anything hidden from HIM?. Is anything too hard for HIM.?.. Somehow and somewhere in our Christians walk of life, we tend to tolerate some amount of nonsense. Try and identify yourself with any of these…

-Each time you are introduced to someone, you expect it to be done in a particular fashion … any less and you begin to feel disappointed !
-You always expect people to speak good about you … if you ever get a hostile reception or a non friendly treatment, you tend to develop a grudge against
them… though you donot show it out loud.!
-You aren’t approachable any longer… because you have outclassed your old circle of friends/people who are yet to make it big, like you … you try and avoid
them…  if you run into them you limit your conversation without leaving much room for any casualness !
-A blessing of yours, which was intended to glorify God, is suddenly diverted to glorify your SELF!
-A Gift that has come all the way from the Holy one, isn’t a gift any longer, but a well earned REWARD by you.!
-Your ‘success’ isn’t attributed to God any more, but is instead cited along with the long struggle, you had to go through, that preceded it – alll glory to your
hard work and SELF again.! God’s name comes somewhere in the end – the conclusion prayer..!
-People think YOUR prayers are Spiritfilled / wisdom filled / awesome – and you begin to think You have something to do with it.!
-You begin to feel a little disappointed / offended / down … when someone you did a favour to, doesn’t come back to thank you.!
-You begin to feel terrible and leftout, when your name is omitted in the list of people to thank, in your office / Easter drama / Church thanksgiving
service… erroneously / deliberately don’t matter.!

task:  I want you guys to make an effort and think of all those instances .. where your efforts are recognised or acclaimed, and figure out what exactly is it that you guys go through, even as you are lifted up… [be it at home / church / community service / office]
Is the attitude, that of  “thankzgiving to GOD” ?`…… or is it ANYTHING other than that…!

to be continued…

content.rendered:
Good morning,

1 Samuel 2:2, “No one is holy like the LORD, For there is none besides You, Nor is there any rock like our God”

“Lord you are more precious than SILVER, Lord you are more costly than GOLD, Lord you are more beautiful than DIAMOND and nothing I desire compares with you” song written by Lynn Deshazo I believe in 1982. Short powerful song sang in many churches. I was thinking about the song over the weekend and wondered what Lynn thought while writing this song. She must have done some homework to look at different things to compare with the Lord before writing the song.

Not too long ago I was watching something on TV, there is this family that assembles motor bikes from scratch. As they continued with the process of making one bike, the metals used in making the bike did not look attractive and I did not see how it was going to come out until they took the metals and dipped them in a boiling silver then I saw how that metal turned in a silverish, mercury look, precious, clear looking metal.  You could see yourself on that metal. Did Lynn see how silver changes the looks of things and all that was not great looking all of a sudden looked sharp and concluded that God was still more precious than silver? I know so too.

She did not stop there, she says the Lord is more costly than gold. I watched another movie entitled “The Italian Job” and there were these many blocks of gold. I had never seen  shinny gold like that. They were good looking so expensive that they had to be kept in a precious safe and guarded. One block was worth million of dollars yet the Lord is still more costly than all the gold in the world put together. Imagine walking on the streets of gold in heaven. That the glory of the Lord makes you see the quality and the value of the gold and still all that, He is more costly than it. Lynn could not see anything that could come even close. I could have stopped there because already didn’t see anything that can be compared to God.

Lord you are more beautiful than diamond. I also saw a movie “Blue Streak”, one of the thieves broke into a jewelry store and picked out this huge piece of diamond. If the light hit on it, the radiance from it would blind the eye. It looked crystal clear, with a nice good looking shape. I am told that there are some diamonds that look flawless but if you look at it well with the magnifying glass, you can see in it some impurities. Then there are those diamonds that are called flawless, they are very rare and very expensive. Can you imagine the Lord being more beautiful than all the diamonds put together. He is so shinny, crystal clear, flawless. The are many people who could do anything to get silver, gold and even diamond but as for me nothing can be compared to the Lord. He is my Silver, my Gold, my Diamond, He is more than any of these things put together. Let people chase after all these in life, I will chase after Him. If you sing the song again, Lynn is not degrading these items all she says is the “Lord you are MORE”. She is not denying the fact that they have great value only not compared to the Lord. People tend to use some of these things to measure their worth, what can you use to measure God’s worth?

1 Samuel 2:2, “No one is holy like the LORD, For there is none besides You, Nor is there any rock like our God”. I have searched around and there is no one, I mean no one who is like Him. He is unique within Himself lacking nothing. No god has even come close and never will. He is so Holy, no one is as Holy as He is. He is flawless that is how Holy He is. No none besides Him or above Him. He has no competition. Nor is there any rock like our God, gold and diamonds are rocks yet there is no ROCK like our God.

title.rendered: From the Pasture to the Palace, by Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“Now then, tell my servant David, ‘This is what the LORD Almighty says: I took you from the pasture and from following the flock to be ruler over my people Israel (2 Samuel 7:8).”

God has a unique way of reminding us how He called us and raised us up for His purposes.  God speaks through Nathan the prophet to David and he begins by reminding David of where he found him: “I took you from the pasture and from following [tending] the flock.”  God was reminding David how far he had come from.  Samuel was to choose a king from among Jessie’s sons and passed by each one realizing that they were not the one that God had chosen.  The Lord had said to Samuel, “Look not on his countenance, or on the height of his stature;…for the Lord sees not as man sees; for man looks on the outward appearance, but the Lord looks at the heart.”  Samuel beckoned to Jessie if he had called all of his sons, but there was still one more in the field seemingly unaware at what was taking place at his home.  David was faithfully tending his sheep and God would call David from the pasture to the palace, from sheepherding sheep, to shepherding God’s people.  David didn’t fill out an application and interview for the position of King.  God looked and God simply choose him.  Why does it seem that God chose him?  The lyrics of one of Carmen’s songs are, “When others see a shepherd boy God may see a king.”  God call David initially because he was a great military leader, but because he was faithful in the small things.  He took care of the little that was entrusted to him, his sheep, and since he was faithful in the small God would raise him up to be faithful of much.  What would happen to David’s sheep if he left to be king?  God has a unique way of working things out as Paul said in Romans 8:218, “And we know that in all things God works for the good of those who love him, who have been called according to his purpose.” God would now use David to be a King after God’s own heart, and that is a heart that David seemed to have beating in his life from the pasture to the palace.

Application:  What is God calling you to do?  In what way is he raising you up? Are you being faithful at the little things, so that he can trust you with greater things, or trying to claw our way to the top? Your talent may take you to the top but only your character will keep you there. Be faithful in your pasture (that what He has entrusted to you) so that God can place you in his way, and in His time in the palace He has for you.  Your family, friends, co-workers, boss, etc.., need to see a shining testimony of you being faithful in the little things.

content.rendered:
Good morning,

2 Samuel 6:11, “The ark of the LORD remained in the house of Obed-Edom the Gittite three months. And the LORD blessed Obed-Edom and all his household”

It’s fascinating to know that the ark talked about in the bible only refers to two people. We have Noah’s ark and the ark of the covenant which signifies the presence of God. I could be wrong but I don’t hear anything about another ark. If you read about the ark again in the bible, you will find that they all fall back to these two arks. The ark that Noah built with direction given to him by God saved a family (8 humans), Noah and his wife with their three sons and their wives. Noah’s ark was a big ark that had it’s work for a season but when you talk about the Ark of God, though small in size by our look of it, it supersedes Noah’s ark that only saved eight souls. God’s ark, the ark of the covenant saved and blessed the Israelites.

The Ark of the covenant had such a great significance, it was the center of Israel’s worship and Elohim (the strong Creator) performed many miracles by ark of the covenant.  The purpose for the Ark of the Covenant was to symbolize Yahweh Elohim’s visible throne on earth. The covenant was God’s promise to human race, a promise He would not break simply because He is God. Because people would not approach God directly then, I believe the ark of the covenant was to always remind the Israelites of God’s presence amongst them. To bring hope and strength as they faced many challenges especially their enemies. As already said, the ark did not just symbolize the presence of God, by it God also perfumed miracles. Victories over the enemies were obtained through it, people were blessed through it. This really troubled their enemies especially the Philistines that they decided to capture the ark but instead of gaining blessings and victories, it turned out to be a curse to them. The ark of the covenant could not be handled carelessly and could not just be handled by anyone. The way it ended in Obed-Edom’s house was because Uzzah reached out to support the ark of the covenant when it stumbled. God killed him for doing that. Not sure why but maybe he thought he could help God, or he thought his hands were clean and we know the main reason was a proper process of handling the ark did not take place. The Levites were the elected to handle the ark, they were consecrated for that purpose.

What turned out to be someone curse turned out to be Obed-Edom’s blessing. I don’t think Obed-Edom did anything special for God to bless his house while the ark remained there. Ordinary guy letting God be God in his house. Maybe just worshipping and yet feeling unworthy to have the ark in his house but still glad that God chose to bless him in spite of. His spiritual life must have been blessed and increased, his marriage, his children, his business were blessed because God had his hands over his household. For three good months he was blessed, I don’t think after those three months he would have wanted the ark to leave. Just one touch from God is enough to change your life completely, the very reason we don’t want to let go of God. When you sought to have the presence of God, the first thing is, the enemy can’t stand it, second your life is defined by the presence of God, you see yourself a whole lot clearly in the light of His glory and you are changed in His presence. 1John 3:2, “Beloved, now we are children of God; and it has not yet been revealed what we shall be, but we know that when He is revealed, we shall be like Him, for we shall see Him as He is”. You are reminded of his covenant to mankind, His promises he made to His children and all you can desire is His presence and His blessing. Obed-Edom might have been an ordinary guy yet that did not stop God from reaching out to him. This is to let us know that it’s not just pastors, evangelists, key leaders who can have the presence of God, everyone can. Allow the Ark of the covenant to rest always in your life, in your family, business, in everything and everywhere you go. You too can be an ordinary person with an extra ordinary blessing. Blessings Evans

– and then there also are these people in your life… old friends / relatives / class mates / teachers / tutors … who serve as page reminders… each time you run into them … you cannot help but be reminded of your tainted / unfortunate / painful past …

only to add to this..

alright then… lets get back to the GOOD BOOK …. where all the answers wait…!

title.rendered: Above and Beyond the Call of Duty, By Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Pastor Phil would like to share again this devotion from 2003, Our prayer is you will be refreshed this morning. Ev

Benaiah son of Jehoiada was a valiant fighter from Kabzeel, who performed great exploits. He struck down two of Moab’s best men. He also went down into a pit on a snowy day and killed a lion. And he struck down a huge Egyptian. Although the Egyptian had a spear in his hand, Benaiah went against him with a club. He snatched the spear from the Egyptian’s hand and killed him with his own spear.  Such were the exploits of Benaiah son of Jehoiada; he too was as famous as the three mighty men.  He was held in greater honor than any of the Thirty, but he was not included among the Three. And David put him in charge of his bodyguard. 2 Sam 23:20-23

Benaiah was a valiant fighter, and certainly excelled greatly in his duty.  He performed GREAT exploits, as they are listed.  He took on fierce opponents, a lion, and even with only having a club, disarmed an Egyptian warrior and killed the man with his own spear.  He became as famous as the three mighty men, held in greater honor than any of the Thirty, but not included among the Three, even though David promoted him by placing him in charge of his bodyguard.  What did the Three do that Benaiah didn’t do?  Well let’s look at their story.

David longed for water and said, “Oh, that someone would get me a drink of water from the well near the gate of Bethlehem!” So the three mighty men broke through the Philistine lines, drew water from the well near the gate of Bethlehem and carried it back to David. But he refused to drink it; instead, he poured it out before the LORD.   “Far be it from me, O LORD, to do this!” he said. “Is it not the blood of men who went at the risk of their lives?” And David would not drink it. Such were the exploits of the three mighty men.2 Sam 23:15-17

David was the King that had a desire, water.  He didn’t give a command, he didn’t make his request part of his men’s job description, and he didn’t have an expectation that these three men should take up the task of his “craving” for water from Bethlehem.  King David was in the line of Jesus Christ as reads in Matt 1:1 “A record of the genealogy of Jesus Christ the son of David, the son of Abraham:”

Three mighty men
Out of loyal to David these men went well beyond “the call of duty.”  They were brave and courageous with only three of them breaking through the host of the Philistine army after their twelve mile journey to get there.  These men had to break through enemy lines, the Philistine garrison (outpost) in Bethlehem, retrieved the water, and bring it back to David.  These men were not commissioned to do this task.  They sacrificed their very lives not to gain clout or merit, not to be in the Israeli hall of fame, and not even to advance the victory for their army.  No these men had on thing on their minds, to bring some water for their king!  Why, because this is what would please the King.  With loyalty and honor they risked their lives, “counting their lives worth nothing,” just to please the King to which they longed to do, even putting themselves in “death’s way,”.   Haggai 1:8 reads, “Go up into the mountains and bring down timber and build the house, so that I may take pleasure in it and be honored,” says the LORD”.  God is our King and desires me to please Him!

While Benaiah certainly excelled in his duty, and was promoted as such, the Three went above and beyond the call of duty just to please their King.

Application:  Are you excelling for God, or are you going above and beyond your call of duty?  What is your call of duty you ask?  He has showed you, O man, what is good. And what does the LORD require of you? To act justly and to love mercy and to walk humbly with your God (Mic 6:8). Be that loyal husband, devoted father, committed ministry leader.  Word hard at your job and be faithful and diligent in reaching the lost.

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“You prepare a table before me in the presence of my enemies…”Psalm 23:5

David wrote Psalm 23 toward the end of his life, and therefore it is his reflection of God worked in the life of David.  David had the following experiences: tending sheep, defeating Goliath, being chased by King Saul, being anointed King of Israel, committing adultery, repenting of his sin, etc….  To say that David had a full life of vast experiences would be an understatement.  Many of us are familiar with this most popular Psalm but what snapshot of David’s life was he thinking of when he wrote, “You prepare a table before me in the presence of my enemies…?”  Was Goliath on his mind, or one of his many battles that he led?  I believe that David reflected on the time he was sheep were hunted by a lion or a bear that could easily devour and carry it away.  However David was the sheep, and he wasn’t being hunted by a foreign army, or even any such enemy of Israel, he was being hunted by an enemy lion, with the attributes of Satan who seeks to steal kill and destroy, that was supposed to be on his side. 

“He came to the sheep pens along the way; a cave was there, and Saul went in to relieve himself. David and his men were far back in the cave. The men said, “This is the day the LORD spoke of when he said to you, ‘I will give your enemy into your hands for you to deal with as you wish.’ ” Then David crept up unnoticed and cut off a corner of Saul’s robe (1 Sam. 24:3-4).”

Perhaps the worst enemies of all are those that you think are on your side, but that pursue your demise.  There may be any number of reasons such as jealousy or bitterness, which in the case with David and Saul seemed to be the prevalent reasons.  David learned how to dodge Saul’s spears time and time again, and now David is hiding out far back in a cave.  Interestingly enough though while David and his men where at the back of the cave, guess who laid down to rest near the front of cave?  Saul!  God had prepared a table for David in the presence of his enemy Saul.  David had Saul in the palm of his hand as David was standing over a sleeping Saul he raised his blade over Saul. WOW, God given David’s enemy into his hands for him to deal with as he wished.  David being more honorable man then Saul, chooses to spare Saul’s life, but bringing the blade down and cutting off a piece of Saul’s robe to show that he could have taken Saul’s life.

“…The eyes of the LORD are on the righteous and his ears are attentive to their cry;” God’s favor rested with a righteous David as he brought his enemy to him and placed David’s enemy in a vulnerable state.  God has a way of bringing down our enemies, and preparing a table of blessing before us in their presence.  David could have killed Saul, but he didn’t.  David implored what we now read as Christ’s words, “Bless your enemies.”  Are their perhaps those that are seeking your demise because God is looking with favor upon you?  Do not fear because God has a way of bringing your enemies to your feet and preparing a table before you in the very presence of your enemies.

Application:  Have you been following the world’s advice of “don’t get mad, get even?”  “Do not take revenge, my friends, but leave room for God’s wrath, for it is written: “It is mine to avenge; I will repay,” says the Lord. On the contrary: “If your enemy is hungry, feed him; if he is thirsty, give him something to drink. In doing this, you will heap burning coals on his head (Rom 12:19-20).”

Blessings Pastor Phil

title.rendered: #148 so, who gets to take the blame…!

content.rendered:
who do you think is responsible for that sad state of yours … ?

– whom are you blaming for the messy relationship you are in…!
– who according to you is responsible for the laid back attitude in your team…
– whose mistake was it… regarding the follow up items that were never addressed…
– do you really think that the state you are in is because someone badly screwed up somewhere…!
– do you believe that the pathetic condition your office is in, is a result of some bad management… and you even go around convincing people about it..!
– when someone had to own up the responsibility for the flaw in the project that was committed by the team, were you the first to do it or were you amongst those who quickly concluded on who exactly screwed up..!

or wait a second …. lets talk on more familiar grounds…

– do you think that your dad and mom could have done a far more better job…

– did you think your teachers / elders / lecturers / advisors didn’t live upto your expectations .. or more satiably put… they didn’t live upto God’s expectations
– your best friend … who later turned your worst enemy… did he/she screw your life up …
– your circle of friends … the ones from school / the gang from college with whom you hung out all the time / or the one’s at office – Do you believe that they are responsible for your sad state today…

– is it that girl/ boy whom you had a big crush on … but the person hardly cared .. and you could never let go off her/him till date ..
