title.rendered: Blessings and Curses – Part 4, by Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“Then he said to the tree, “May no one ever eat fruit from you again…”

Jesus spoke a destructive miracle into being!  Of all the miracles that Jesus performed, none of them was of a destructive nature other then the cursing of the fig tree.  Upon leaving Bethany Jesus was hungry, and saw a fig tree in the distance, and therefore went over to it to satisfy his hunger.  However upon at the tree he noticed that it only bore leaves, but NO fruit.  Then Jesus spoke the words of cursing upon the tree, “May no one ever eat fruit from you again.”  This doesn’t quite make much sense in light of Mark stating, “He [Jesus] found nothing but leaves, because it was not the season for figs.”  Why is Jesus cursing a tree for having no figs, but every other fig tree had the same testimony, “because IT WAS NOT THE SEASON FOR FIGS.”  Was it reasonable for Jesus to curse the fig tree for not bearing its fruit out of season? 

Dr. Christie in his book ‘The Barren Fig Tree,’ explains six weeks before figs were actually to bear upon the tree in April, the tree would have first have the foliage coating complete.  Coincident with [this], and sometimes even before, there appears quite a crop of small knobs, NOT THE REAL FIGS, but a kind of early forerunner.  They grow to the size of green almonds, in which condition they are eaten by peasants and others when hungry.  When they come to their own indefinite maturity they drop off.  These precursors of the true fig are call taqsh [”pre-figs”] in Palestinian Arabic.  Their appearance is an indication, a sign, of the fully formed figs which were to appear six weeks later in.  Mark says the time for figs had not come yet.  However if the leaves appear without any taqsh [pre-figs], that is a sign that there will be no figs appearing six weeks later.  Since Jesus was hungry and found nothing but leaves, leaves without any taqsh, he knew that it was an absolutely hopeless, fruitless fig tree, and said as much.

Jesus said in John 15:5, “I am the vine; you are the branches. If a man remains in me and I in him, he will bear much fruit; apart from me you can do nothing.”  And in Matthew 7:21-23 “Not everyone who says to me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ will enter the kingdom of heaven, but only he who does the will of my Father who is in heaven. Many will say to me on that day, ‘Lord, Lord, did we not prophesy in your name, and in your name drive out demons and perform many miracles?’ Then I will tell them plainly, ‘I never knew you. Away from me, you evildoers!’

People will say to Jesus on that day [Judgment Day], look at all the things I did in Your Name Jesus.  In Your name we prophesied, cast out demons, performed miracles, we knew every worship song and joined the choir, we even started ministries, etc….  God wants fruit in lives and many people will point to things in their lives, all of their spiritual accolades, but Jesus was saying to those in Matt. 7, “All I see in your life is leaves, but NO FRUIT.  You did those things all right, but I NEVER KNEW YOU, because you never did ABIDE IN ME all that is plain to see now because all of your efforts are just leaves and that is not my will, my will was that you bear fruit.  There is only one reason that you produced leaves instead of fruit, because you lived disconnected from me, although you were very religious, but you did NOT do my will, but YOUR OWN!  Depart from me! Many do works for God, apart from abiding in Him.  If faith without works, hence works with abiding, being connected to His heart and will is also dead (fruitless). If the life of Christ permeates a disciple, fruit will be inevitable, NOT leaves.  May we give Him what He wants, FRUIT.

Application:  Are you bearing leaves or fruit in your life, because Jesus only honors fruit!
Blessings
Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

1 Timothy 6:17, “Command those who are rich in this present age not to be haughty, nor to trust in uncertain riches but in the living God, who gives us richly all things to enjoy.

We serve a God of too much do you know that? The God who is out to bless His children far beyond what they could ever imagine or think. He has not reserved the blessing for some people but to everyone. I am fascinated by the fact that God has blessings for everyone, He has not withheld any blessing from anyone, what troubles me is people.  See when God begins to bless you and take you places, you don’t have a problem with God but have a problem with people because people have a problem with you being blessed by God. This is not new, in the book of Genesis, the first murder occurred because someone was blessed. As long as Abel had not won the attention and the affection of God, Cain was alright, the moment Abel was blessed, Cain had an attitude with him. There was nothing in him to trigger jealousy and hatred for his brother until the blessing was bestowed on Abel. Cain takes his jealousy and frustrations and dumps it on his brother by taking his life. I saw this with Saul and David, as long as David had not won the attention of God and God in turn God blessed him, Saul was ok but the moment God began to bless David, Saul was out to take his life. What about when Jesus was born, king Herod heard Jesus king of the Jews was born. A little tiny baby was already a king  being worshipped. The three shepherds were led of by the star to the place where a king who did not even have a throne here on earth was worshiped. Upon hearing all these, king Herod was out to destroy Jesus. All these three (Abel, David, Jesus) had something in common, “Blessed of God”

Where I’m I going with this? When God begin to bless don’t expect to be liked and well received by everyone. Blessings in your life are enough to trigger jealousy and hatred from some people. I hate to say this but I see this mostly among Christians. Christians who desire to see you blessed of God, they even talk about it and the moment God begins to bless you, they begin to give you attitude. They will try to assassinate your blessings, say things to make you feel guilty about being blessed, lie on you, trying by all means to put you down, saying things to kill your spirit then the blessing that you were suppose to enjoy, becomes a curse. People’s comments pierce you deep within, you try to explain yourself, you even try to hide the blessing or if revealed, you want to act like it is nothing for example, someone looks at a material thing God has blessed you with and says something nice about it and what do you do, you degrade the blessing by saying, it’s nothing, it was just a cheap, simple thing. Why are we afraid to enjoy God’s blessings? Hasn’t the bible said, “the living God gives us richly all things to enjoy?” Good family, good job, beautiful wife, handsome husband, well behaved children, blessed ministry, nice home, nice car (all things to enjoy) . If a person has a problem with you being blessed, ask them not take their frustrations on you but on God who blessed you. Why would you want to forfeit your blessing on someone else actions? Why should you get people’s approvals before you enjoy God’s blessings? After all God will not check with anyone if He should bless you. Those who are frustrated with you right know nothing about your history. They don’t know what you went through to get where you are, the mountains you had to climb, the valleys of the shadow of death you had to pass through. The days you would sit and wonder whether God had even a blessing for you. The days you felt like giving up, sat down and just cried your eyes out. Now that you are blessed of God, why should you continue to feel bad because someone has a problem with God blessing you? You and I need ask ourselves this question, “CAN WE STAND TO BE BLESSED?”. Can you stand to ride above what people say or think when you are blessed? Many people’s blessings are turning out to be curses because they have allowed people to make them feel bad about being blessed. It’s not people’s attitude that will cause God to bless you more, it’s your attitude towards the blessing. It’s how you respond and act upon it.  2 Corinthians 1:20, “For all the promises of God in Him are Yes, and in Him Amen, to the glory of God through us”. Because God has promised to bless me and I am blessed, I refuse to act like I am not blessed and I refuse to let anyone make me feel bad about being blessed, I want to survive being blessed because he has given me all these blessings to enjoy. If I wait till everyone likes me to enjoy the blessings, I will waste everyday and I won’t be surprised if God stops blessing me. I enjoy the blessing, He gets the glory we call it a deal.
Blessings Ev

title.rendered: Blessings and Curses – Part 3, By Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

I wish to let you know that you are welcome to add your family members and friends directly to our devotion team address book by sending me their addresses so that they can receive the devotions the same time you receive them without you going through the trouble of forwarding. Take the advantage. Ev

“…No branch can bear fruit by itself; it must remain in the vine. Neither can you bear fruit unless you remain in me.   “I am the vine; you are the branches. If a man remains in me and I in him, he will bear much fruit; apart from me you can do nothing. If anyone does not remain in me, he is like a branch that is thrown away and withers; such branches are picked up, thrown into the fire and burned.”  John 15:4 – 6

Many professing Christians seem to be religious lives, but not fruitful ones.  What Jesus did when He was alone with his disciples is that he spoke to them about living productive, fruit-bearing lives.  Just as in Psalm 1, the key for the tree to be nourished was being rooted near the streams of water and having the water travel up the root system all the way to the branches to produce fruit, so to do we find a similar illustration here.  Jesus emphasized strongly that “…no branch cam bear fruit by itself.  Can you imagine cutting off a branch from a tree, and expecting it to produce fruit when disconnected from the source of nutrients?  That would be absurd.  Jesus points out that in the same way, no one can live a fruitful life UNLESS and only UNLESS they remain in Him!  It is not enough for a branch to be near the vine (trunk), it must be connected.  Jesus tells us that HE is the VINE and we are the branches. 

If we are in Christ it will show forth from our lives.  A healthy vine cannot but help bear grapes, a healthy orange tree will bear oranges, etc…, and a healthy Christian life will bear the character of Christ and reproduce souls into the Kingdom of God.  It has been rightly said that when a husband and wife are intimate children and born, and likewise when one is intimate with the Lord souls are born again!  Peter denied the Lord, wept bitterly in repentance, and eventually became the leader of the Apostles as he preached at Pentecost (Acts 2), he wrote first and second Peter, and eventually would be crucified upside down for Christ not feeling worthy to die in the same exact manner as his Lord.

Why would a professing Christian stay fruitless.  Jesus tells us that there are some branches don’t produce fruit ever, because they are not connected to the vine.  A branch cannot bear fruit unless it is attached, and if it is not it withers up because the branch can only die without life flowing to it.  When I cut branches off from trees all they were good for eventually was fire wood because they were nice and dry and dead, as dead wood burns the best.  A life unconnected to Christ will be one that is picked up and thrown into the fire.  Judas was a fruitless branch that betrayed Jesus and ended up committing suicide.  Judas was NOT connected and everything that Judas influenced was toward death!  Jesus said, “And fear not them which kill the body, but are not able to kill the soul: but rather fear him which is able to destroy (cast) both soul and body in hell.”  Unconnected lives that stay unconnected will end up in the Lake of Fire.  Rev. 20:15 reads, “If anyone’s name was not found written in the book of life, he was thrown into the lake of fire.”

An absolutely fruitless life is evidence that one is not a believer.  “Fruit bearing is not only possible but certain if the branch remains in union with the vine. Uniformity of quantity and quality are not promised. But if the life of Christ permeates a disciple, fruit will be inevitable (EBC).”

Application:  Is there fruit in your life that you are Christian?   Do others recognize that Christ is in your life?  Ask two trusted believers and two non-believers how they view your relationship with God?  And above all remain in Him and you will bear fruit and show to belong to Him!  Go and reach the unconnected lives in your life and connect them to Christ! Blessings Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
– He is a good tutor… He doesn’t charge any fees. all He wants is your undivided attention…!
– He can teach you anything under and above the SUN… His knowledge of things is outstanding … matchless…!
– Breaking a CODE / building a program / designing a matrix / engineering a device / dismantling and rebuilding a gadget / writing a thesis / answering an
assessment / understanding the cycle / researching and resolving …. He is a MASTER in them all ..
– He knows exactly where that missing pendant / watch / diamond ring / wallet of yours is … He also knows whether you need it back or not..!
– He knows how much you love your friends … He reminds you of their birthdays …
– He is your alarm clock … He never needs to be reset…
– He is your standard DIET check … and He will remind you of all your hasty new year / birth day resolutions that you hardly or never keep…
– He is your SMOKE control / FAT control / GYM instructor
– He is FUN to be with… lots of FUN to be with …

– When you don’t know what to pray for … He is right there … reminding you of every situation that needs to be lifted up in prayer…
– He helps you intercede for the people in your life …
– He places in your heart a burden for their lives…
– He gives you an insight in to their problems …. into their trials / circumstances / situations …
– He grieves through you … in you … and helps you pray when you just don’t know what to say …
– When you don’t know what to pray for … He is the best person to ask for help!
– He can never be boring … for He is trendy … that USB drive / jazzy pen size music player that you have is entirely outdated in HIS sight ..
– He is the best possible critic you can ever get, to discuss that novel you’ve been reading … for HE knows the TRUTH … for HE is the TRUTH…
– you needn’t ever be anxious about HIM leaving your side … for HE is God’s gift for you … and God’s gifts are irreversible …
– but please make sure, that you don’t offend HIM in any manner … it would be the gravest SIN you would’ve ever committed …
because it cannot be forgiven ….
– He is so GOOD at everything, that you don’t even have to tell HIM the problem … for He already knows the solution …

Yesterday, at around 11 PM, I was a live witness to my dear friend receiving the HOLY SPIRIT …. it all happened before my own eyes … she was filled … she started to speak in tongues … she was drunk in the SPIRIT … and it was an awesome experience for her ..

title.rendered: You Are The Salt Of The Earth

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Due to some circumstances, Pastor will not bring the word today, here is a word I shared with our devotion team in August of 03. Be blessed

Mathew 5:13, “You are salt of earth…”

A couple of weeks ago after getting off work and went home, upon reaching I decided to get a cup of nice, hot, spiced tea. Once I poured it into the cup, I found a dish with a substance I thought was sugar, being confident that was sugar, I scooped two spoon full into the tea, stirred it up and made the first sip, boy was I wrong. That was no sugar but salt, I missed my precious tea but understood the power of salt

Salt is  a colorless or white crystalline solid, chiefly sodium chloride, used extensively in ground or granulated form as food seasoning and preservative. It’s an element that gives flavor. This is it’s primary function.

There is something about salt that we need to understand because it shows us what Jesus meant when He said, “You are the salt of the earth”. I just read somewhere that there are 14,000 uses of salt. Let’s look some of the things salt does. Small pinch of salt can make food taste,  as for sugar, you might use more before you can make something taste. Salt is not made out of something like sugar, salt mostly are found around the lakes, oceans, streams. Salt are used to melt ice, we use salt it to preserve meat, treat wounds. salt creates thirst, salt stops colors from fading especially on clothing materials. I’m told that salt causes water to boil faster, it can be used to peel boiling eggs faster, greasy pans can be cleaned using salt.

We have been made in a way that we can add flavor because we are salty. Everyone has a chance to do something, you can melt a hard heart, you can preserve by your salty words, you can treat wounds, you can create thirst for righteousness, you can stop precious things from fading away, you can clean using your words in other words, by all means you can be a salt that the Lord will use to restore someone. Remember that a pinch of salt can do greater things. You don’t have to be an expert, scientist, doctor, professional to salt someone else, all you got to do is remember what Jesus has called you, SALT and know where you get your salt from.

Mathew 5:13, “… but if the salt looses it’s flavor, how shall it be seasoned? it is then good for nothing but to be thrown out and trampled underfoot by men”, It is possible to loose your saltiness and that happens when you disconnect yourself from the stream of water where salt is found. We are to be like a tree planted by the river bearing our fruit (salt) in our season. Who wants to use salt that has no flavor? and who will want to use salt that is not effective?

Check your personal life, do you consider yourself to be a salt? if you are, are you salting the people around you in every way the salt can be used? Are you stretched to the maximum in the sense that you are fully utilizing your saltiness to affect your surrounding? This is not for some people, this is for all believers who are connected to the living stream. Salt through prayers, encouragements, helping out, spending time with someone etc

Thanks
Evans

– how about waking up one fine summer morning, on your bed, and discover that there is someone waiting for you …
– someone who is eagerly waiting for you to open your eyes …
– someone sent all the way from heaven … to be your best friend …!
– someone who is more handsome than any man you ever met … more beautiful than any person you ever saw …
– someone who understands you completely ..
– who knows you inside out … who is able to tolerate all your misbehaviour and correct you gently…
– who is very soft in nature … sweet as sugar … wiser than the wisest soul you’ve known
– he never leaves your side … even in the wash room …
– he goes with you into the game … the meeting … the brawl …
– he gives you the best counsel available for your annual client meeting … with his expertise you are able to convince anybody and sell anything …
– he provides you ideas that become bigtime best practises all over the world …
– he inspires you to become an inspiration for many others …
– with HIM around, people just look at you and feel encouraged … peoples lives get transformed with your mere presence ..
– with HIM on your side you lay hands on people, and they tremendous amount of peace …
– with HIM around no one dares to argue with you… not because you are good at it, but because you are a peace maker
– with HIM around you won’t feel upset, left out, dejected, down  and stuff liike that because … well you just don’t miss anyone at all… HE quite makes up for
them all …
– with HIM around joy flows through like no ones business …
– with HIM around you, people feel the presence of GOD in their lives …
– people get healed… they get delivered … without you even realizing it…

task : no suspense… the HE I am talking about is the HOLY spirit of GOD…. we’ll talk more about Him tomorrow

title.rendered: #144 here’s what it is  – the ultimate conclusion

content.rendered:
We all need HELP don’t we… especially after realizing all that we are capabale of in our flesh and blood … There is HELP available …
There is someone who was there from the beginning. He was and is and is! He is the ONE and the ONLY HOLY SPIRIT.
Do not cast me from your presence or take your Holy Spirit from me. psalm 51:11 Cried out David to God, because he knew life was going to be miserable without the Holy Spirit.
This is how the birth of Jesus Christ came about: His mother Mary was pledged to be married to Joseph, but before they came together, she was found to be with child through the Holy Spirit. Mathew 1:18 Jesus, who was and is and is to come, came through the HOLY SPIRIT into this world.
“I baptize you with [ Or in] water for repentance. But after me will come one who is more powerful than I, whose sandals I am not fit to carry. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and with fire. Mathew 3:11 Not by might …. not by power …. but by my SPIRIT says the LORD.
Anyone who speaks a word against the Son of Man will be forgiven, but anyone who speaks against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven, either in this age or in the age to come. Mathew 12:32  God the Father and God the SON are very possessive about the God the SPIRIT, because He is very gentle and sensitive… He chose to leave the TRINITY and come down to be with US.
Whenever you are arrested and brought to trial, do not worry beforehand about what to say. Just say whatever is given you at the time, for it is not you speaking, but the Holy Spirit  His presence is with us all the TIME. He speaks through us. The POWER / BOLDNESS/ AUTHORITY / comes from HIM.
But you will receive power when the Holy Spirit comes on you; and you will be my witnesses in Jerusalem, and in all Judea and Samaria, and to the ends of the earth.” acts1:8  POWER – The power that comes from GOD, out of HIS love for us. And its for free.
All of them were filled with the Holy Spirit and began to speak in other tongues [ Or languages; also in verse 11] as the Spirit enabled them.acts2:4 The gift of tongues, which is for EVERYBODY, is a free gift. It is meant for personal edification. Is not the FATHER more than willing to give HIS gifts to anyone who asks.
Peter replied, “Repent and be baptized, every one of you, in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of your sins. And you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.acts2:38 The HOLY SPIRIT is sent for US. For the everyone of US. And if you have accepted Christ, you WILL receive the HOLY SPIRIT.
After they prayed, the place where they were meeting was shaken. And they were all filled with the Holy Spirit and spoke the word of God boldly.acts4:31
We are witnesses of these things, and so is the Holy Spirit, whom God has given to those who obey him.”acts5:32
Are you obedient to GOD? If your answer is a YES, then ARE YOU SURE?
“You stiff-necked people, with uncircumcised hearts and ears! You are just like your fathers: You always resist the Holy Spirit!acts7:51
Without realizing, that you are, Are you resisting HIM ?
task: are you filled with the HOLY SPIRIT? if NO, what are you waiting FOR. ask HIM!

title.rendered: #143 let me get you thinking… part 3

content.rendered: all that good time you used to have in church .. it’s somehow absent now … you don’t feel that way anymore. the fire seems to be dying … and you doubt if you should be changing your church? .. you don’t get to go to Church as often as you used to or want to, anymore … you promised yourself that you’d give a pastor/ evangelist a gift, but never really gave it .. because you totally forgot about it or didn’t want to .. you don’t stay back for fellowship after the service … you just don’t feel like it …you feel that the people suck … especially after those miserable facts you heard about someone in church who was having an illegitimate affair and also about that prayer cell leader who hit his dad in the face… you don’t visit your friend’s / family / relatives (that widower uncle / old widow aunty whom you had promised to visit every weekend) its been a long while since you spent time with your BIBLE … you just don’t know why …! and you also prayed, “Lord if its your will, then make me read the BIBLE” … you tried that nice book by the Christian author, but it sounded a little too boring and serious for you… each time you sit with the BIBLE you don’t know what to read and where to start … and when you finally force yourself and do start-of with a chapter/book … the next day you get back to reading it.. you wouldn’t even remember where you stopped last… you wouldn’t even remember which book or for that matter which testament in the bible.. the sermons don’t appeal to you the way they did … it appears, you read the bible for the sake of reading it… you pray for the sake of praying …you goto church for the sake of going to church .. you so badly wanted to goto the pub for the team outing …and you actually did … but you had a terrible time keeping yourself away from the drinks … you hate that feeling that follows .. you hate the pressure of people looking upto you … looking out for you … and you ask , “why am i always under the watch?” you’ve been praying about something for so long, and nothing has been coming up … you don’t know what to think of it … you don’t know what’s on God’s mind…? He is absolutely quiet about it … and it bugs you… you actually gave up praying about it … and you think you’ll just take whatever comes your way … its the same job … same pay (pretty much) .. same people … same home … long time since holiday … same family … same bills month after month.. if not more … increased petrol prices … higher tax … suddenly all that you’ve learnt from and about the BIBLE seems so distant and too good to be true … and you begin to feel life’s so laid back … okay … we are sluggards… but DO WE KNOW there is HELP just for US ? … to be continued …

title.rendered: #142 let me get you thinking part 2

content.rendered:
every one of has complaints …
if not against each other all of us have something or the other against what God allows in our lives…
– a few of you go about speaking it aloud, and sharing your so called misfortune with everyone they meet …
– a few of you cry your their hearts out to your dear ones / family / friends and then you feel better…
– and a few of you don’t share it with anyone and inturn carry that grudge against God …
– you weep your hearts out night after night, crying out to God to relieve you off your unfortunate state …
– you have something to say about everything… inspite of knowing that everything comes from HIM…
– you have your own suggestions and improvisations for every blessing that comes your way..
– you also begin to get judgemental about all the stuff  – the bonuses – the tax ..
– your conversations with people aren’t pleasant always…
– as much as you dislike it… you continue to loose your temper here and there … especially before those with whom you wanted to set a Christ like example – you frown at something and get caught in the act…
– you make a gesture that displays outright frustration and end up attracting everyone’s attention …
– you shout at your MOM .. you shout at your maid and then also your dog … and also regret that you were loud enough for your neighbours to hear you..
– you make a pass at your boss, and then bite your tongue …
– you can’t help but find a dirty joke humorous, and invite a “I didn’t know you enjoyed this kinda stuff” from a colleague..
– you friends in Christ call you asking if you are okay… and you hate that ..
– you aren’t able to enjoy praise and worship sessions as you always did …
– you prayer times are more dependant on what’s on HBO …
– you would frankly describe your spiritual life as “ups and downs”

to be continued ……

content.rendered:
Christianity: It actually could have been a very cool cycle. check this out…
You repent of your sins …
You ask Christ for forgiveness…
You then accept Christ into your heart…
You then follow Him in the waters of baptism…
then one day you’d die and be on your way to heaven…

boy this is great stuff … truly great stuff … after all the apprehension i went through because of my sinful lifestyle, this appears so very relieving…
thank God for Jesus… but heyyyyy hold on … let me make it sound a little more appealing… check this out
you accept Jesus … you get baptized … then you goto heaven…
is that cool or what?
hey but wait a second… if that were the case, why do we still live our wretched lives on this wretched planet … what are we waiting for … ?
why doesn’t God just take us all away …? as in. why doesn’t he just let us all die the ‘one time death’ here, so that we could live our eternity in heaven with the KING… but it doesn’t work thatt way … does it ?… you might have been saved five years …. baptized 4 years … but still continue to face temptation … but still struggling to resist it … and at times also giving into it … only to later on feel terrible about it… boy what’z happeniing … why all this …? … you still won’t stop flipping those dirty channels .. you continue to have a big mouth, and speak stuff behind peopls backs … and when a fellow believer points it out, you not just refuse to accept it, but also start talking about that person too … you aren’t tithing …. you aren’t giving with a open heart … you aren’t simply doing stuff that you are supposed to be doing as a Christian but everything else… Now….! If Christ had come so thatt we could live our lives to the fullest… then why is that we still are struggling with elimentary things/ strongholds and are just not able to come over them …
where is this royal preisthood / chosen generation stuff that Jesus talked about … ? did He just say it just for the sake of saying it.. or was it meant only for those who take up preisthood or full time ministry or something like thatt …. i just don’t get it..!
i am not done as yet …!
If i am supposed to be rejoicing in the Lord all the time… why do i still feel down?
why do i still feel terrible about certain things ….? why do people still hurt me to the core … why do they persecute me …? yes it is persecution.. you’ll know if you are there with me … why do i cry in the nights … does GOD not care anymore …? why ? why?

task : are you able to place yourself any where, in what you read so far … well if you are abel to relate to any of it … then please wait for the continuation ..

title.rendered: #140 the WORD came to Ezekiel and the WORD is for us!

content.rendered:
Ezekiel 18: 1 The word of the LORD came to me: 2 “What do you people mean by quoting this proverb about the land of Israel: ” ‘The fathers eat sour grapes, and the children’s teeth are set on edge’? 3 “As surely as I live, declares the Sovereign LORD , you will no longer quote this proverb in Israel. 4 For every living soul belongs to me, the father as well as the son-both alike belong to me. The soul who sins is the one who will die. 5 “Suppose there is a righteous man who does what is just and right. 6 He does not eat at the mountain shrines or look to the idols of the house of Israel. He does not defile his neighbor’s wife or lie with a woman during her period. 7 He does not oppress anyone, but returns what he took in pledge for a loan. He does not commit robbery but gives his food to the hungry and provides clothing for the naked. 8 He does not lend at usury or take excessive interest. He withholds his hand from doing wrong and judges fairly between man and man. 9 He follows my decrees and faithfully keeps my laws. That man is righteous; he will surely live, declares the Sovereign LORD . 10 Suppose he has a violent son, who sheds blood or does any of these other things 11 (though the father has done none of them): “He eats at the mountain shrines. LOVE that is beyond all your imagination.
LOVE that is so great than any other form of it- About LOVE that is the key to our salvation joy – The LOVE that bonds us with one another.

The LOVE that established the greatest RELATIONSHIP ever.
The LOVE that puts to rest, all fear, all apprehension, all doubt, all anxiety, all hatred, all jealousy.
Love that answers all questions without leaving any confusion.
Love that breaks walls / barriers / hurdles between opposites.
Love that builds bridges / connects with ropes the enemies.
Love that melts metal / even hearts of stone.

God so loved the world….
It was God who first loved.

What is the relationship that we have with HIM.

Is it that of a FATHER and SON ?
Is it that of a Master and servant ?
Or is it that of Trader and slave ?
No.

It is that of FRIEND. Isn’t that amazing. The BIBLE contains the GREATEST real time story ever told. The story of a wonderful FRIEND, who wilfully gave up His LIFE so that His friends could LIVE.
Is there a more greater LOVE than this. No there isn’t.

SO, if you ever have questions about your LIFE, that start with a “WHY” or a “WHAT”  or a “WHEN” or even a “WHO”, then remember, that a BEST FRIEND that you could ever possibly have, died for you – For the sake of His LOVE for you.

content.rendered:
Silence. How can i ever forget that word. I remember growing-up watching the wooden tablet that hung across the school corridor.. with words in brass pinned to it… It read… ” SPEECH IS SILVER, SILENCE IS GOLD “. The board had such an overwhelming impact on us kids. Atleast in the hall where it still hangs today, i am sure, the kids make the least noice.
There is something about silence. Something wonderful… its always a “quiet blue skies” or a “quiet gentle stream flowing past the green pastures”… when it comes to poetic discriptions..
When everything goes quiet, you get to hear real clear. You get to focus! You don’t have to struggle and pay attention.
There are many other good sides.
When the Lord our God, said, “Be still and know that I am God” .. he obviously meant, …. “shut up … quiet down … sit back … worry not … you are Talking to GOD … Yes GOD Himself… so, just relax and know that I AM capable of GREAT things… and awesome wonders … there isn’t anything that is impossible for me… knowing that, there isn’t much left to ponder… so for now.. just spend time with me”
That is God, as lovely as ever…!
Lets look at another dimension, about this aspect of silence, as God sees it!!
The King was being persecuted. He is taken into custody. Ill treated, mocked, falsely accused, punched at, spat at…! And guess what He does
Mathew 26:63 But Jesus remained silent. Boy isn’t that something. When I first read this portion I personally felt the Lord should have given them all a piece of HIS mind. I wished He spoke some mind-boggling WORDS of wisdom, and make Caiphus and party run helter skelter searching for a counterfeit argument. Or may be, a MIRACLE that could shut the mouths of all the accusers for ever.
But little did i understand then, that the Lord, who was in flesh and blood, was humbly coming under authority. He could have rightfully claimed HIS position as the HIGH PRIEST, but NO. Jesus the Christ instead choose to submit to the authority bestowed upon Caiphus the PRIEST. The priest was being wicked, but wait a second, He still held the chair. Jesus, who being in very nature GOD, did not consider equality with God something to be grasped. Phil2:6.

This Good Friday, my beloved, let us sit back – and be quiet, both physically and mentally. Let us put aside all that we always have to say, and maintain SILENCE. Let us maintain SILENCE so that we may be able to LISTEN, to what God our Father has to say.

Psalm 121
1I lift my eyes to the hills…
You look at all the heaps of workload / pending bills-loans / hectic schedule / delayed resolution / pressure / misunderstandings / bad relationships / parent teacher meetings / society meeting / water problem in the locality..
where does my help come from?
and wonder how on earth are you ever going to acquire desired results. If there ever is going to be a day, where you donot worry about anything
2My help comes from the Lord,
Well guess what! HELP is on its way from the Lord of all. In HIS perfect time, he will give the trouble He purposefully allowed in your life a proper climax. You are not to worry bro’. For the KING Is on the ROLL.
the Maker of heaven and earth.
If you are doubting the Lord’s capability, well here’s what He did. He spoke and the whole universe came into being. He is the one who appointed your boss. He is the BOSS of all your bosses! In case you didn’t know.
3He will not let your foot slip-
He is going to make sure you don’ crash like your software. He is going to make sure you don’t give up like losers do.
he who watches over you will not slumber;
The Lord never messes like you do, nor does he ever forget his appointments like you do! He is on time. Wait a second, He made TIME, and unlike you and I he is not caught up in it.
4 indeed, he who watches over Israel
Remember Israel couldn’t not be wiped over the face of the earth. The Lord’s hand was upon them.. at the centre of the earth
will neither slumber nor sleep.
He is not like the antivirus that gave up on your system. Nor is he like the government policy maker who failed to be trendy and updated. He never ever sleeps. Remember the 6 hour mandate rest rule – well that doesn’t apply to HIM.
5The Lord watches over you-
He has his Angels dispatched to take special care of you. Especially when you are having a tough day at work. You and I may loose focus and turn away from Him. But He never takes His eyes of us. NEVER. I know!
the Lord is your shade at your right hand;6the Sun will not harm you by day, nor the moon by night.
His presence goes with you, day and night. He never leaves your side, whether you like it or not. And no one, I say that again – No one can touch you, with Him by your side.
7The Lord will keep you from all harm-he will watch over your life;
Each time you thought, it was a close shave, well you don’t have to chuckle at the escape, just remember it was the LORD.
8the Lord will watch over your coming  and going both now and forevermore.
We were born in SIN – lived in SIN, and even dwelled in SIN. And the Lord, who is without SIN, never gave up on us!

Its been a while since I wrote on GIVING..!
Or atleast the last time I wrote on GIVING It was much to do with the offertory bag.
Now lets talk on a much more broader front.

Did you know, that LOVING and GIVING always go hand in hand. Love was and is always associated with Giving.
“God so loved the world, that He gave……”

If you are telling yourself that you LOVE someone, or something very much, then by default you should also be willing to GIVE or GIVE-UP, for the sake of that someone or something…!

I’ve always been a frantic fan of the basket ball game. I would try and watch all the playoffs, I could, on TV. I’d play on weekday mornings and on weekends too. During the season my thoughts would always be oriented around the game. I realized over a period of time that I had absolutely no time allocated for God. I realized that the game was becoming more and more important to me than Jesus. So one day I gave my commitment to God, saying “Lord I am willing to give up this game, for your sake. I want to spend time with you”. I felt a lot relieved even as I said that prayer. Just about the same time, my sports shoes had given up on me. And I didn’t get myself another pair. I stopped playing the game. And for almost 6 months I kept myself away from it. It was tough all the way through. And one Sunday evening, the Lord spoke to me. He said, “Abhi, I want you to play today”. I was, for a moment, shocked. I knew it was the Lord, because I kept asking Him if He were serious, and a tremendous amount of peace descended over me. My heart leaped with joy. And that Sunday evening I had one of my best games ever. I was shooting well, laying it up well, I was stealing the ball – boy I was all over the court. I was worshipping the Lord that evening even as I played on the court. Something I would cherish forever.
Today, the Lord actually uses me as a witness at the court, where people from several nationalities come to play. Its a part of my ministry, today! I am usually the peace maker, when I see a potential brawl picking up, over a foul or a wrong call. If they need someone to call, its gottu be me! If someone was to ref’ the game, I am the first choice. The guys wouldn’t use profanity, especially when I am around. A couple of them even wanted to come to church. One of them wanted to find out if i dance (he wanted to call me over to a private disco). And i told Him, “Yes, I dance, but only during worship in Church”! And that amazed Him.
When i look back, I see that I gave up something for my Lord. And as gracious and sovereign and wisdom filled as He is, the Lord uses the same thing to glorify Himself. Isn’t HE cool. Isn’t He awesome.

Faith…
I can move a mountain ..
I can do all things through Christ…
who strengthens me…..

This again is a song we sing in church..! Its one of those songs that I had a tough time with, both meaning and singing at the same time, because, it appeared as though it was far more easier said than done…!:)
I am going to tell you how important it is to have FAITH.
– It is so important, that the absence of which will uprightly disqualify you from being a CHRISTIAN.
– You cannot serve God without FAITH. You cannot please God without FAITH.
– You cannot preach the good news about Christ effectively without FAITH.
– You cannot be used effectively for God’s glorification without FAITH.
– If you asked me, no point
Now lets understand what exactly is FAITH…!
– Faith is to believe that God allowed that difficult project to test you to the core and give you nightmares, because He wants you to get strengthened..
– Faith is to believe that God purposefully placed your BOSS , who is so difficult to work with, in your life…
– Faith is to boldly affirm and believe that Jesus did rise on the third day, when a bunch of atheist literature buffs mock and challenge you by showing false historical proof that contradicts the WORD…
– Faith is to sit amongst seemingly convincing critics, who question the very sanctity and authority of the bible, by the so called practical and realistic talk…  (they don’t understand Holy spirit, do they?… for them its a compilation across the ages by various people, who wrote stuff as it was at their time)
– Faith is to choose to be called STUPID by them, than compromise!
– Faith is to tell someone without any doubt in mind that unless they believe in Jesus, they would be heading to HELL.
– Faith is to thank God, when you find yourself in a deficit budget.
– Faith is to thank God, when your boss/ colleagues make an unnecessary propaganda about an unfortunate error at your end.
– Faith is to Joyfully give away the money God specifically told you to give someone, knowing very well that you would run into a deficit budget.
– Faith is to go ahead and take the interview, in spite of all the apprehension.
– Faith is to pray for others first and then pray for your own needs, even if you your own urgent needs lined up and are in times of trial.
– Faith is to REJOICE in the LORD all the time -Especially during negative feedback / post a bad annual appraisal / when paying tax / when called to work on a weekend / when asked to leave / when put on bench / when crushed / when ….. blah blah blah

content.rendered:
Let me first apologize for not being able to send the continuation any earlier..! please pray that i am able to send these messages on a daily basis…

i know its been a while, so lets do a quick recap of the first three guidelines ..

1. Rejoice in the Lord always … !  ……
2. Give thankz in all circumstances, for this is God’s will for you in Christ Jesus.  …….
3. And we know that in all things God works for the good of those who love HIM, who have been called according to HIS purpose…. And if God be for us who can be against us? ……

4. If God be for us, who can be against us …
Isn’t that so encouraging! Its one outright statement that has the potential to drive away all fear – all anxiety – all apprehension! Be it success or failure – Be it approval or rejection – Be it deadlines or targets – Be it end of the day or end of week – Be it now or never – Be it promotion or demotion – Be it a raise or deduction …… whatever be it, the assurance that God is going to stand by our side, all the way through, gives such a sense of strength, courage and relief!

5. ask and it shall be given …. ask and it shall not be given…!
First things first, there is no harm in asking! A child is expected to ask the father! That is how it is! There is no other way around it. Good stuff / bad stuff don’t matter!! It is right for the child to ask the father and the father alone, because the Father not just knows the desires of the child’s heart (I am talking about the heavenly father here), but He also knows what is good for the child and what is not! Isn’t that so cool!
I mean, just imagine! You first lift up your requests to the Father in Heaven, and ask Him for His will to be done. He then gives you the BEST! And also there are times, when we ask for stuff, and the Father denies them because, in SIMPLE terms, we are asking for something that doesn’t mean good for us. Or say put it this way, “Our Father in Heaven is a better judge, any DAY”. I’d seek His counsel!

6. Donot be anxious about anything, but in everything, by prayer and petition, with thanksgiving present your requests to God!
Now, isn’t that a really really cool way to conclude this manual! I think it pretty much sums up everything that we, as born again Christians, needs to know before we face the everyday wars in the spiritual world!

and what comes out of it… well this is what that comes out of it…!

And the peace of God which transcends all understanding will guard your hearts and your minds in Christ Jesus.

is that cool or what?

title.rendered: #129 Captain’s guide for the boot camp …!

content.rendered:
1. Rejoice in the Lord always … !

No exceptions … [ NO situation can ever be a valid exception. however bad it is]. The bible doesn’t talk about any exceptions. SO BE IT!
And rejoicing as in the actuall meaning as per the Oxford English Dictionary.
Meaning: verb feel or show great joy. a feeling of great pleasure and happiness. 2 a cause of joy. 3 Brit. informal success or satisfaction
2. Give thankz in all circumstances, for this is God’s will for you in Christ Jesus.

So, whatever be the circumstances [no exceptions whatsoever], we are asked to give thanks to God. We are talking about God’s will for us.
This is especially for those of us who are struggling to find out God’s specific WILL in their lives, here you are! This is the REVEALED WILL of GOD.
It cannot be any clearer than this. Go ahead and thank God, for whichever situation you are in, with all your heart mind soul and strength.

3. And we know that in all things God works for the good of those who love HIM, who have been called according to HIS purpose…. And if God be for us who can be against us?

Considering the all of us really walk and live the most important commandment, the above assurance is very easy to understand. For those who want to know what the first and the most important of all commandments is, here you go…
Love the Lord your God, with all your heart, mind, soul and strength and love your neighbour as your self!
The Lord never gives up working in us. He’s still working in those many areas inside us, where we are yet attain Christ like attitude/ likeness. And even as HE is working, He ensures that something good will come out of every situation we get in to. EVERY SITUATION…. ! period!

holiness … holiness is what i long for …
holiness is what i need ..
holiness is what you want from me …

Its a song that we sing in my Church here..!
I like it for many reasons – great tune and lyrics etc. Yet again each time I sing it, I can sense my conscience pricking me. Is Holiness what I really long for.? Am I really yearning to be HOLY.?  If I am, I should be striving towards achieving it. But on the actual side I am struggling to get the fundamentals right.

God wants us to be HOLY.
The WORD says we MUST be holy! Now, when someone says MUST, you aren’t left with too many options. And in this particular case, we aren’t left with any at all!
For God our Father never compromises on HIS HOLINESS. Nor does He ever compromise on being JUST or RIGHTEOUS. He is PERFECT. And the WORD says, be PERFECT as your father in heaven is PERFECT! And mind you, being PERFECT also means being GOOD. And Jesus himself says, “Only God is good”.
That is where a few of us JUMP and say, it is impossible to be Good, because God Himself says that He alone is Good! whatta wrong statement to make!
Now wait a second He never said, “it is impossible for us to be good”… He never said, “it is impossible for us to PERFECT” … but He knew very well our helplessness … He knew very well that our basic nature was to SIN …
God knew how inclined we were towards SIN … nobody knew as well as He did because, if we remember, He bore our SINS …! He’s been looking at us since ages … since the TIME He made us ..! I am not sure if He ever regretted for having made us … but one thing I am sure, He never gave up on us…

Okay now! Going back to where we started … It is an extremely difficult task to fight TEMPTATION … to fight SIN …
it is almost next to impossible to resist temptation at peak hour attacks, if you were trying to do it on your own ..!
so what then…! Are we to remain like this …! Forever struggling!

heck NO… God wants us to RESIST TEMPTATION EVEN AS WE DRAW NEAR TO HIM…!

that’z the key… In HIM we are able…! In HIM ALONEEEEEEE!

task:
resume back your quiet time with Jesus
resume back to your personal time of prayer
you may read it before, but read the BIBLE all over again…
go back to that bible study you stopped going to ..
get back to Church activities
GET BACK

title.rendered: #126 are you a NERD in the spiritual world…

content.rendered:
are you able to relate to these..

-you may have admitted many times that you are empty inside but do you really know that you are…
-you are selfish, evil, bad by nature ..
-are you the kind of person who constantly gets discouraged …
-do you time and again make efforts in getting your path straight with God, but continue to fall and are very discouraged
-is there a temptation in your life that you are struggling with ..
-have you attempted numerous ways, to overcome the struggle but still somehow end up with the same sin..
-are you the fed up of listening to people who are always trying to encourage you without realizing that they are stamping on the only nerve you seem to have ..
-are you bugged with counsellors that are not sought by you ..
-are you tired of being so vulnerable and indecisive …
-do you find it hard to believe that salvation is for free ..
-do you have a tough time understanding GRACE, even though you’ve preached it yourself…
-do you often become a victim of unavoidable confrontations where your faith is questioned and your stand mocked – may be because of your lifestyle ..
-do you take your dear ones for granted, only to later on get humiliated, because you weren’t expected to take them for granted …
-to the question, how is your spiritual life, is your answer consistently a, “up and down”… symbolically associated with a flickering movement of the wrist..
-you find yourself opening up to non believers only to later regret..

If you are able to relate to the above mentioned statements then congratulations, you perfectly fit the category of the poor in spirit! and there is nothing we need to worry about, because ours is the kingdom of heaven..!
The beatitudes as said by Jesus, “blessed are the poor in spirit, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven …”

Our assurance is in Jesus …!
Our Hope is in Jesus..!
Our refuge is in Jesus..!
He is the only way we’ve got..!

task : don’t handle that thing you are trying desperately to fix … let Jesus handle it..! Its a wise thing to do!

content.rendered:
meet the man/woman inside you …
i am talking about the one that does all your thinking …
the one that does all your decision making …
the one that does all the pondering, imagining, exaggerating etc. for you!
the C.E.O of your entire being
i am talking about your ‘self’

-we still call people fools ..
-we still get into the judgement mode and already form a pre-notion about every individual we come across ..
-we continue to judge our colleagues and detest them deep within our hearts …
-we continue to fear stuff that shouldn’t be feared ..
-we continue to use the same language/ listen to the same music / abuse art / involve in some amount of pornography- all that we had once put away ..
-we still continue to lust for someone / something … without even realizing that we are …
-there still are those difficult people that we avoid … not realizing that God placed them there..
-we somehow join the mockers club … the very one we are to avoid. And mock the righteous / the just by calling them ol’ fashioned or orthodox
-our interests in the worldly affairs (stuff that doesn’t glorify God) somehow never actually cease!
-we gossip.. without realizing that we actually are! saying negative stuff about someone, when the person in question is not around, which otherwise wouldn’t have been said in his presence… usually facts!
-we continue to get prank mails / dirty jokes / forwards that don’t glorify God … instead of putting an end to them, we still allow ’em
-we still get upset with people and inturn allow that displeasure to affect our treatment of them ..
-we still go watch movies which don’t glorify God …
-we still get drunk at parties/ at home / smoke our lungs without realizing that our bodies are temples of Christ..!
-we still watch television .. too much of it ..!
-WE STILL DON’T LOVE THE LORD, THE WAY WE SHOULD!!

1.and yet when in Church, we are the best Christian around ..!
2.we continue promise people we are going to lift up their requests in prayer ..
3.we attend Bible studies, and even offer counsel

task :  now wait a second, Is God blind, that He isn’t able to see all this ?
Is God busy that hasn’t really been paying you attention and you have yourself a quick getaway?
Is God merciful enough to forgive you without you even asking for forgiveness?

don’t just read along..! the questions are meant for us to answer…

content.rendered:
Hebrews 5
1Every high priest is selected from among men and is appointed to represent them in matters related to God, to offer gifts and sacrifices for sins. 2He is able to deal gently with those who are ignorant and are going astray, since he himself is subject to weakness. 3This is why he has to offer sacrifices for his own sins, as well as for the sins of the people.
4No one takes this honor upon himself; he must be called by God, just as Aaron was. 5So Christ also did not take upon himself the glory of becoming a high priest. But God said to him, “You are my Son;
today I have become your Father.6And he says in another place, “You are a priest forever,
in the order of Melchizedek.”
7During the days of Jesus’ life on earth, he offered up prayers and petitions with loud cries and tears to the one who could save him from death, and he was heard because of his reverent submission. 8Although he was a son, he learned obedience from what he suffered 9and, once made perfect, he became the source of eternal salvation for all who obey him 10and was designated by God to be high priest in the order of Melchizedek.
11We have much to say about this, but it is hard to explain because you are slow to learn. 12In fact, though by this time you ought to be teachers, you need someone to teach you the elementary truths of God’s word all over again. You need milk, not solid food! 13Anyone who lives on milk, being still an infant, is not acquainted with the teaching about righteousness. 14But solid food is for the mature, who by constant use have trained themselves to distinguish good from evil.

task : meditate on this scripture please … there’s much more to it ..

there’s the primary reason we were made..!

content.rendered:
I believe in enhancement of self … in development .. in growth … in adding values .. in betterment ..
all these in the best interest of our Christian self ..!

God wants us to grow …
-from milk babies, who need their nappies to be cleared to meat eating adults …
-from being without hope to being someone who’s only HOPE is in the Lord …
-from individuals who need constant encouragement to spiritual counsellors  to  whom many look upto for encouragement …
-from an individual who cannot survive without fellowship with friends/family  to  someone who fellowships with the Lord
-from someone who constantly gives into temptation to someone who resists it ..
-from a person who is only happy worshipping at church to someone who seeks more of the Holy Spirit and also the gifts of the Spirit..
-from someone who fears all the worldly related matters to a spirit filled Christian who drives out demons in the name of Jesus..
-from someone who gives up easily and succumbs to difficult circumstances to a prayer warrior who never gives up and waits on the Lord…
-from and individual who has a tough time controlling his/her temper to someone who humbles him/herself to utmost extent and doesn’t ever hesitate to
submit to authority
-from being a difficult / harsh / tough / negative / critical person to someone who is very approachable and out of whom living waters flow ..
-from someone who has a tough time during offertory to someone who readily gives without the slightest hesitation ..
-from someone who talks loosely / hastily to someone who is very careful with the tongue ..
-from a person who has a hard time remembering things to someone who knows the WORD by heart …
-from someone who is indisciplined / eats junk food/ sleeps late / lazes around / watches too much television to someone who spends much time reading the WORD/ praying and takes good care of the health and disciplines the body..
praise Him in the bad times …
-from the worldly Christian to the Christ like Christian

check this out …
